0.content: There is a representation of Marduk here on this stele—the Code of Hammurabi. According to Hammurabi, the Code was given to him personally by Marduk.” Hiro wanders over to the Code of Hammurabi and has a gander. The cuneiform means nothing to him, but the illustration on top is easy enough to understand. Especially the part in the middle: “Why, exactly, is Marduk handing Hammurabi a one and a zero in this picture?” Hiro asks. “They were emblems of royal power,” the Librarian says. “Their origin is obscure.” “Enki must have been responsible for that one,” Hiro says. “Enki's most important role is as the creator and guardian of the me and the gis-hur, the ‘key words' and ‘patterns' that rule the universe.” “Tell me more about the me.” “To quote Kramer and Maier again, ‘[They believed in] the existence from time primordial of a fundamental, unalterable, comprehensive assortment of powers and duties, norms and standards, rules and regulations, known as me, relating to the cosmos and its components, to gods and humans, to cities and countries, and to the varied aspects of civilized life.' ” “Kind of like the Torah.”
0.title: Cuneiform code of Hammurabi with depiction of Marduk handing Hammurabi a one and a zero
0.abstract: A cuneiform tablet is disclosed, the tablet comprising two rows of text written in cuneiform script. The first row of text reads as follows: Anu-shakin-gal (Anushirvan) king amar-utu(Hormuz I), son of Ugbarugbu (Bahram Gur), king of Elam, made an alliance with Shamash-shum-ukin (Shapur I), king of Babylon; he gave him his daughter Adad-guppi (Adda Guzane).

1.content: And then I got to thinking, why do motorized wheelchairs always have to be tiny pathetic things that strain to go up a little teeny ramp? So I bought this—it is an airport firetruck from Germany—and converted it into my new motorized wheelchair.”
1.title: Motorized wheelchair
1.abstract: A motorized wheelchair includes a frame, a drive system, and a controller. The drive system is operable to propel the wheelchair along a ground surface. The controller is configured to control operation of the drive system in response to user input received via an input device associated with the wheelchair. The controller is further configured to detect that the wheelchair has reached a predetermined distance from a first location using a global positioning system (GPS). In response to detecting that the wheelchair has reached the predetermined distance from the first location, the controller causes the drive system to decelerate such that the wheelchair travels at a substantially constant speed for a predetermined period of time. After the predetermined period of time expires, the controller resumes controlling operation of the drive system in response to user input received via the input device.

2.content: The magic words are “We Have Pull-Thrus,” which means you can enter the franchise, hook up, sleep, unhook, and drive out without ever having to shift your land zeppelin into reverse. They used to claim it was a campground, tried to design the franchise with a rustic motif, but the customers kept chopping up those log-and-plank signs and wooden picnic tables and using them for cooking fires. Nowadays, the signs are electric polycarbonate bubbles, the corporate identity is all round and polished and smooth, in the same way that a urinal is, to prevent stuff from building up in the cracks.
2.title: Franchise campground with pull-thrus
2.abstract: A franchise campground is disclosed. In one embodiment, the franchise campground comprises a plurality of campsites configured to accommodate recreational vehicles (RVs) and/or tents. Each campsite may include an electrical outlet for providing electricity to RVs parked at the campsite. The franchise campground may also include a reservation system that allows users to reserve a campsite prior to arriving at the franchise campground. Additionally, the franchise campground may provide amenities such as restrooms, showers, laundry facilities, dump stations, picnic tables, grills, fire rings, trash receptacles, recycling receptacles, drinking fountains, water spigots, Wi-Fi access points, security lighting, emergency call boxes, information kiosks, mailboxes, telephone booths, vending

3.content: Just a single principle: The Deliverator stands tall, your pie in thirty minutes or you can have it free, shoot the driver, take his car, file a class-action suit. The Deliverator has been working this job for six months, a rich and lengthy tenure by his standards, and has never delivered a pizza in more than twenty-one minutes. Oh, they used to argue over times, many corporate driver-years lost to it: homeowners, red-faced and sweaty with their own lies, stinking of Old Spice and job-related stress, standing in their glowing yellow doorways brandishing their Seikos and waving at the clock over the kitchen sink, I swear, can't you guys tell time?
3.title: Method and apparatus for delivering a pizza in thirty minutes or it's free, shoot the driver, take his car, file a class-action suit
3.abstract: A method of preparing a pizza includes receiving an order to prepare a pizza. The method further includes determining that the order is eligible for expedited delivery by identifying one or more ingredients needed to prepare the pizza; retrieving the one or more ingredients from a refrigerated warehouse; placing the one or more ingredients onto a conveyor belt; conveying the one or more ingredients along the conveyor belt at a predetermined speed; assembling the one or more ingredients into the pizza as the one or more ingredients are conveyed along the conveyor belt such that the pizza is assembled while the one or more ingredients are being conveyed along the conveyor belt; and communicating information regarding the assembly of the pizza to a user device associated with the recipient of the pizza.

4.content: Squirrelly scrubbing noises squirm from its sidewalls as they grind against the curb; we are in the Burbs, where it is better to take a thousand clicks off the lifespan of your Goodyears by invariably grinding them up against curbs than to risk social ostracism and outbreaks of mass hysteria by parking several inches away, out in the middle of the street (That's okay, Mom, I can walk to the curb from here), a menace to traffic, a deadly obstacle to uncertain young bicyclists. Y.T. has pressed the release button on her poon's reel/handle unit, allowing a meter of cord to unwind. She whips it up and around her head like a bolo on the austral range. She is about to lambada this trite conveyance. The head of the poon, salad-bowl size, whistles as it orbits around; this is unnecessary but sounds cool.
4.title: Method and apparatus for scrubbing squirrelly scrubbing noises squirming from the sidewalls as they grind against the curb; we are in the burbs, where it is better to take a thousand clicks
4.abstract: A method of removing unwanted noise from an audio signal. The method includes determining one or more frequency bands corresponding to harmonics of at least one fundamental frequency present in the audio signal by applying a fast Fourier transform (FFT) to the audio signal using a plurality of FFT window sizes. The method also includes performing a spectral whitening operation on the determined one or more frequency bands that corresponds to the harmonics of the at least one fundamental frequency included in the audio signal. Performing the spectral whitening operation comprises calculating a weighted sum of the determined one or more frequency bands according to a pre-determined set of weights. Further, the method includes subtracting the calculated weighted sum of the determined one or more frequency bands from the audio signal resulting in a filtered version of the audio signal. Finally, the method includes outputting the filtered version of the audio signal.

5.content: There is kind of an outer cloud of small boats surrounding the Raft for a distance of a few miles. Almost all of them are fishing boats.
5.title: Method and apparatus for creating an outer cloud of small boats surrounding the Raft for a distance of a few miles. Almost all of them are fishing boats.
5.abstract: A method is disclosed for operating a boat, comprising: (a) moving the boat from a first location to a second location; (b) while at the second location, determining that one or more predetermined conditions have been satisfied; and (c) in response to determining that the one or more predetermined conditions have been satisfied, automatically causing the boat to move from the second location to a third location. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

6.content: Desktops encourage the use of paper, which is archaic and reflects inadequate team spirit. What is so special about your work that you have to write it down on a piece of paper that only you get to see? That you have to lock it away inside a desk?
6.title: Paperless desk
6.abstract: A paperless desk is disclosed. The paperless desk includes a table top, an electronic device holder, and a drawer. The table top has a first side and a second side opposite to the first side. The electronic device holder is attached to the first side of the table top. The electronic device holder holds at least one electronic device. The drawer is slidably coupled to the second side of the table top. The drawer is configured to slide along the second side of the table top between a closed position and an open position. When the drawer is in the open position, the electronic device holder is accessible from the second side of the table top. In some embodiments, when the drawer is in the closed position, the electronic device holder is inaccessible from the second side of the table top.

7.content: “We may have found an unprotected stash.” “What is this totally irritating noise?” “Bioelectronic sensor. Human cell membranes. Grown in vitro, which means in glass—in a test tube. One side is exposed to outside air, the other side is clean. When a foreign substance penetrates the cell membrane to the clean side, it's detected. The more foreign molecules penetrate, the higher the pitch of the sound.” “Like a Geiger counter?” “Very much like a Geiger counter for cell-penetrating compounds,” Ng says. Like what?
7.title: Systems and methods for detecting cell-penetrating compounds using bioelectronic sensors
7.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting one or more cell-penetrating compounds (CPCs) in a biological sample. In some implementations, an implantable device is provided that includes a plurality of electrically conductive electrodes configured to be positioned proximate to a target tissue site within a subject's body. The implantable device also includes at least one sensor coupled to the plurality of electrically conductive electrodes, wherein the at least one sensor is configured to detect CPCs bound to the plurality of electrically conductive electrodes. Additionally, the implantable device includes circuitry operably coupled to the at least one sensor, wherein the circuitry is configured to receive signals from the at least one sensor indicative of the presence of CPCs bound to the plurality of electrically conductive electrodes.

Up above them on the overpass embankment, he can dimly make out phosphorescent shapes—green-jacketed Enforcers orbiting some strange attractor. “Watch your steep,” Squeaky says as they begin to climb up the embankment.
8.title: Sushi K rap has all most pretty My special talking of remarkable words Is not the stereotyped bucktooth nerd My hair is big as a galaxy Cause I attain greater technology
8.abstract: Systems and methods are disclosed for an apparatus comprising one or more processors coupled to non-transitory computer readable media storing instructions. When executed by the one or more processors, the instructions may cause at least a portion of the apparatus to perform operations comprising obtaining information associated with a user; determining whether the obtained information indicates that the user is eligible to participate in a lottery game; when it is determined that the user is eligible to participate in the lottery game, providing access to play the lottery game; receiving input from the user indicating participation in the lottery game; generating a plurality of random numbers using a random number generator; comparing the generated plurality of random numbers to a predetermined set of winning numbers; and awarding prizes to the user based on how closely the generated plurality of random numbers matches the predetermined set of winning numbers.

9.content: So we're working on refining our management techniques so that we can control that information no matter where it is—on our hard disks or even inside the programmers' heads. Now, I can't say more because I got competition to worry about. But it is my fervent hope that in five or ten years, this kind of thing won't even be an issue.” A half-hour episode of a science news program, this one on the controversial new subject of infoastronomy, the search for radio signals coming from other solar systems. L. Bob Rife has taken a personal interest in the subject; as various national governments auction off their possessions, he has purchased a string of radio observatories and hooked them together, using his fabled fiber-optic net, to turn them into a single giant antenna as big as the whole earth. He is scanning the skies twenty-four hours a day, looking for radio waves that mean something—radio waves carrying information from other civilizations. And why, asks the interviewer—a celebrity professor from MIT—why would a simple oilman be interested in such a high-flown, abstract pursuit?
9.title: Infoastronomy: the search for radio signals from alien civilizations
9.abstract: Implementations of methods and systems are described herein for detecting extraterrestrial intelligence (ETI). In one implementation, an ETI detection system may include at least one processor programmed to perform operations. The operations may include receiving data indicative of electromagnetic radiation emanating from a celestial object; determining whether the received data is within a predetermined frequency range; in response to determining that the received data is within the predetermined frequency range, processing the received data to determine whether the received data includes a signal characteristic of artificial origin; and in response to determining that the received data includes the signal characteristic of artificial origin, identifying the celestial object as being associated with ETI.

10.content: This approach is somewhat bulky and redundant, as every worker usually brings their own roll. Some offices have attempted to meet this challenge by instituting bathroom-tissue pools. Without overgeneralizing, it may be stated that an inherent and irreducible feature of any bathroom-tissue pool implemented at the office level, in an environment (i.e., building) in which comfort stations are distributed on a per-floor basis (i.e., in which several offices share a single facility) is that provision must be made within the confines of the individual office for temporary stationing of bathroom tissue distribution units (i.e., rolls). This follows from the fact that if the BTDUs (rolls) are stationed, while inactive, outside of the purview of the controlling office (i.e., the office that has collectively purchased the BTDU)—that is, if the BTDUs are stored, for example, in a lobby area or within the facility in which they are actually utilized, they will be subject to pilferage and “shrinkage” as unauthorized persons consume them, either as part of a conscious effort to pilfer or out of an honest misunderstanding, i.e., a belief that the BTDUs are being provided free of charge by the operating agency (in this case the United States Government), or as the result of necessity, as in the case of a beverage spill that is encroaching on sensitive electronic equipment and whose management will thus brook no delay . This fact has led certain offices (which shall go unnamed—you know who you are, guys) to establish makeshift BTDU depots that also serve as pool-contribution collection points. Usually, these depots take the form of a table, near the door closest to the facility, on which the BTDUs are stacked or otherwise deployed, with a bowl or some other receptacle in which participants may place their contributions, and typically with a sign or other attention-getting device (such as a stuffed animal or cartoon) requesting donations. A quick glance at the current regulations will show that placement of such a display/depot violates the procedure manual. However, in the interests of employee hygiene, morale, and group spirit-building, my higher-ups have agreed to make a one-time exception in the regulations for this purpose. As with any part of the procedure manual, new or old, it is your responsibility to be thoroughly familiar with this material. Estimated reading time for this document is 15.62 minutes (and don't think we won't check). Please make note of the major points made in this document, as follows: 1) BTDU depot/displays are now allowed, on a trial basis, with the new policy to be reviewed in six months. 2) These must be operated on a voluntary, pool-type basis, as described in the subchapter on employee pools. (Note: This means keeping books and tallying all financial transactions.) 3) BTDUs must be brought in by the employees (not shipped through the mailroom) and are subject to all the usual search-and-seizure regulations. 4) Scented BTDUs are prohibited as they may cause allergic reactions, wheezing, etc. in some persons.
10.title: Bathroom tissue dispenser and method for temporarily stationing a bathroom tissue dispenser
10.abstract: A toilet paper dispenser includes a housing, a roll of toilet paper disposed within the housing, an actuator operably coupled to the housing such that rotation of the actuator causes movement of at least a portion of the roll of toilet paper relative to the housing, and a locking mechanism. The locking mechanism is movable between a locked position and an unlocked position. In the locked position, the locking mechanism restricts movement of at least a portion of the roll of toilet paper relative to the housing. In the unlocked position, the locking mechanism permits movement of at least a portion of the roll of toilet paper relative to the housing.

11.title: Systems and methods for managing pizza delivery
11.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing pizza deliveries. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an order request from a user device associated with a customer to place an order for a pizza at a first location; determining that there are no available drivers within a predetermined distance of the first location; in response to determining that there are no available drivers within the predetermined distance of the first location, transmitting a notification to the user device indicating that there are no available drivers within the predetermined distance of the first location; receiving another order request from the user device associated with the customer to place an order for a second pizza at a second location; determining that there are no available drivers within the predetermined distance of the second location; responsive to determining that there are no available drivers within the predetermined distance of the second location, transmitting a notification to the user device indicating

Gauge and gag.” “He'll consider it if they can come and check out the merchandise first,” Eliot says. “They want to check out how tight we are, and whether we are capable of suppressing our gag reflex. These are all terms from the Raft brothel industry.” “Ombwas scope like twelves to me, hahaha.” “Us homeboys look like we have twelve-gauge assholes,” Eliot says, “i.e., that we are all stretched out and worthless.” Fisheye speaks up on his own.
12.title: 12-gauge scope clause, chomsayen? gauge and gag
12.abstract: A method of playing a card game is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (a) providing each player with an initial number of cards; (b) allowing players to discard one or more cards from their hands; (c) shuffling any discarded cards into a new hand for each player; (d) dealing additional cards to each player so that each player has a final number of cards in his/her hand; (e) repeating steps (a)-(d) until each player's hand contains at least thirteen cards; and (f) determining a winner according to predetermined winning criteria.

13.content: The telephone remembers and dials Roadkill's number. Roaring sounds. This is the sound of air peeling over the microphone of Roadkill's personal phone at some terrifying velocity. Also the competing whooshes of many vehicles' tires on pavement, broken by chuckhole percussion; sounds like the crumbling Ventura. “Yo, Y.T.,” Roadkill says, “'sup?” “'Sup with you?” “Surfing the Tura.
13.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for using roadkill as a personal phone
13.abstract: A method of using roadkill as a personal phone includes identifying an animal that has been struck by a moving vehicle. The method also includes determining whether the animal is still alive after being struck by the moving vehicle. In response to determining that the animal is no longer alive, the method further includes capturing one or more images of the animal with a camera associated with the moving vehicle. Additionally, in response to determining that the animal is still alive, the method further includes communicating with the animal via a communication device associated with the moving vehicle.

14.abstract: A method of diagnosing and treating glossolalia (speaking in tongues) includes administering to a patient suffering from glossolalia an effective amount of at least one compound selected from the group consisting of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), benzodiazepines, barbiturates, anticonvulsants, neuroleptics, antipsychotics, dopamine agonists, norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors, serotonin reuptake inhibitors, tricyclic antidepressants, tetracyclic antidepressants, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs), mirtazapine, amitriptyline, clomipramine, desipramine, dox

15.title: Nam-shub of Enki
15.abstract: (I) a method for treating cancer, the method comprising administering to a patient in need thereof a pharmaceutical composition comprising an effective amount of at least one compound of Formula (I):or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt, hydrate or solvate thereof, wherein R1, R2, R3 and R4 are as defined herein;(II) a compound of Formula (I);or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt, hydrate or solvate thereof, wherein R1, R2, R3 and R4 are as defined herein;and(III) use of a compound of Formula (I), or a pharmaceutically acceptable salt, hydrate or solvate thereof, wherein R1, R2, R3 and R4 are as defined herein, for the manufacture of a medicament for treatment of cancer.

Ideas such as these were so effective in preventing the spread of Asherah that, eventually, every square inch of the territory where the viral cult had once thrived—from India to Spain—was under the sway of Islam, Christianity, or Judaism. “But because of its latency—coiled about the brainstem of those it infects, passed from one generation to the next—it always finds ways to resurface. 16.title: Asherah and the origins of Islam, Christianity, and Judaism
16.abstract: The Asherah is an ancient pagan goddess that was worshipped by Abraham's father Terah (Genesis 11:31-32) and his grandfather Nahor (Genesis 22:20-24). The worship of the Asherah continued among Abraham's descendants for hundreds of years until it was outlawed by Moses in Exodus 34:13-17.

17.content: “Okay, last time we were talking about the clay envelope. But what about this thing? The thing that looks like a tree?” Hiro says, gesturing to one of the artifacts. “A totem of the goddess Asherah,” the Librarian says crisply. “Now we're getting somewhere,” Hiro says.
17.title: Totem of the goddess Asherah
17.abstract: A totem in the form of a tree trunk having an upper portion and a lower portion. The upper portion is shaped as a female torso with arms extending from the shoulders, legs extending from the hips, and hands clasped together at the chest. The lower portion is shaped as a male torso with arms extending from the shoulders, legs extending from the hips, and hands clasped together at the chest.

18.content: Amusement parks in the Metaverse can be fantastic, offering a wide selection of interactive three-dimensional movies. But in the end, they're still nothing more than video games. Hiro's not so poor, yet, that he would go and write video games for this company.
18.title: Systems and methods for creating and managing amusement parks in the metaverse
18.abstract: Implementations of systems and methods for creating and managing amusement parks in the metaverse are described. In one implementation, an apparatus includes a processor coupled to a non-transitory machine readable storage medium storing instructions that when executed by the processor cause the processor to perform operations. The operations include receiving input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the input specifies creation of an amusement park within a virtual reality environment; determining attributes associated with the amusement park including at least one attribute selected from the group consisting of theme, attractions, rides, food vendors, merchandise vendors, entertainment venues, or any combination thereof; configuring the amusement park according to the determined attributes; and presenting the configured amusement park to the user via the GUI such that the user is able to interact with the configured amusement park as part of the virtual reality environment.

19.title: Glass knife
19.abstract: A glass knife includes a blade and a handle connected to the blade. The blade is made of borosilicate glass or soda lime glass, and at least one surface of the blade is coated with titanium dioxide (TiO2). The TiO2 has an average particle size of about 10 nm to about 50 nm.

22.content: It's bigger than she imagined. The body is Rottweiler-sized, segmented into overlapping hard plates like those of a rhinoceros. The legs are long, curled way up to deliver power, like a cheetah's. It must be the tail that makes people refer to it as a Rat Thing, because that's the only ratlike part—incredibly long and flexible. But it looks like a rat's tail with the flesh eaten away by acid, because it just consists of segments, hundreds of them neatly plugged together, like vertebrae.
22.title: Rat-things and methods of making and using rat-things
22.abstract: Provided herein are rats (e.g., transgenic rats) that express one or more human therapeutic proteins, pharmaceutical compositions comprising such rats, nucleic acids encoding such rats, vectors comprising such nucleic acids, host cells comprising such nucleic acids, and methods of making and using the same.

23.content: Whenever a pirate vessel comes into view, they all take turns looking at it through the sight, playing with all the different sensor modes: visible, infrared, and so on. Eliot has spent enough time knocking around the Rim that he has become familiar with the colors of the different pirate groups, so by examining them through the sight he can tell who they are: Clint Eastwood and his band parallel them for a few minutes one day, checking them out, and the Magnificent Seven send out one of their small boats to zoom by them and look for potential booty. Hiro's almost hoping they get taken prisoner by the Seven, because they have the nicest-looking pirate ship: a former luxury yacht with Exocet launch tubes kludged to the foredeck.
23.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and identifying pirate vessels
23.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized vessel is provided. The method includes receiving, by at least one sensor from the unauthorized vessel, data indicative of characteristics of the unauthorized vessel; determining whether the received data indicates that the unauthorized vessel is within a predetermined geographic area; in response to determining that the received data does not indicate that the unauthorized vessel is within the predetermined geographic area, transmitting information regarding the unauthorized vessel to a remote computing device; and upon receipt of instructions from the remote computing device, modifying operation of the at least one sensor to reduce power consumption of the at least one sensor while maintaining detection capability of the at least one sensor with respect to the unauthorized vessel. Corresponding apparatus, systems, devices and computer programs products are also provided.

24.content: For this reason, rather than trying to package bathroom tissue in small one-transaction packets (as is done with premoistened towelettes, for example), which can be wasteful in some cases and limiting in other cases, it has been traditional to package this product in bulk distribution units whose size exceeds the maximum amount of squares that an individual could conceivably use in a single transaction (barring force majeure). This reduces to a minimum the number of transactions in which the distribution unit is depleted (the roll runs out) during the transaction, a situation that can lead to emotional stress for the affected employee. However, it does present the manager with some challenges in that the distribution unit is rather bulky and must be repeatedly used by a number of different individuals if it is not to be wasted.
24.title: Method and apparatus for dispensing bathroom tissue
24.abstract: A method of dispensing bathroom tissue from a toilet paper dispenser is disclosed. In one embodiment, the method comprises detecting that a user has activated an actuator associated with the toilet paper dispenser; in response to detecting that the user has activated the actuator, determining whether there is any remaining bathroom tissue stored within the toilet paper dispenser; if it is determined that there is no remaining bathroom tissue stored within the toilet paper dispenser, deactivating the actuator; and if it is determined that there is remaining bathroom tissue stored within the toilet paper dispenser, dispensing at least some of the remaining bathroom tissue from the toilet paper dispenser. An apparatus for dispensing bathroom tissue is also disclosed.

25.content: A mountain is growing out of the sea. A bubble of black water that keeps rising and broadening. Well behind the bobbing raft, a black tower has appeared, jutting vertically out of the water, a pair of wings sprouting from its top. The tower keeps getting taller, the wings getting higher out of the water, as before and aft, the mountain rises and shapes itself. Red stars and a few numbers. But no one has to read the numbers to know it's a submarine. A nuclear-missile submarine.
25.title: Nuclear-missile submarine
25.abstract: A nuclear-missile submarine includes a hull, a missile compartment disposed within the hull and configured to accommodate a plurality of ballistic missiles, wherein each of the plurality of ballistic missiles carries at least one nuclear warhead. The nuclear-missile submarine further includes a launching mechanism for launching the plurality of ballistic missiles out of the missile compartment into an air space above the earth's surface, wherein the launching mechanism is capable of simultaneously launching all of the plurality of ballistic missiles from the missile compartment into the air space above the earth's surface.

26.content: “What kind of power are we talking about here?” “Most Kabbalists were theorists who were interested only in pure meditation. But there were so-called ‘practical Kabbalists' who tried to apply the power of the Kabbalah in everyday life.” “In other words, sorcerers.” “Yes. These practical kabbalists used a so-called ‘archangelic alphabet,' derived from first-century Greek and Aramaic theurgic alphabets, which resembled cuneiform. The Kabbalists referred to this alphabet as ‘eye writing,' because the letters were composed of lines and small circles, which resembled eyes.” “Ones and zeroes.” “Some Kabbalists divided up the letters of the alphabet according to where they were produced inside the mouth.” “Okay. So as we would think of it, they were drawing a connection between the printed letter on the page and the neural connections that had to be invoked in order to pronounce it.” “Yes. By analyzing the spelling of various words, they were able to draw what they thought were profound conclusions about their true, inner meaning and significance.” “Okay.
26.title: Kabbalistic sorcery
26.abstract: Computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for Kabbalistic sorcery are disclosed. In one embodiment, a Kabbalistic sorcery method is performed by Kabbalistic software executing on Kabbalistic hardware. The Kabbalistic sorcery method comprises the steps of (1) receiving an input from a user; (2) processing the input to identify at least one Kabbalistic concept associated with the input; (3) determining whether the identified at least one Kabbalistic concept has been used in conjunction with other Kabbalistic concepts within a predetermined period of time; (4) if it is determined that the identified at least one Kabbalistic concept has not been used in conjunction with other Kabbalistic concepts within the predetermined period of time, adding the identified at least one Kabbalistic concept to a list of unused Kabbalistic concepts maintained by the Kabbalistic software

27.content: Whenever he has a katana in his hands he adopts it automatically, otherwise he fears that he may lose his balance and carelessly lop off one of his extremities. Feet parallel and pointed straight ahead, right foot in front of the left foot, katana held down at groin level like an extension of the phallus. Hiro raises the tip and slaps at the spear with the side of the blade, diverting it just enough; it goes into a slow sideways spin, the point missing Hiro just barely and entangling itself in a vine on Hiro's right. The butt end swings around and gets hung up on the left, tearing out a number of vines as it comes to a stop. It is heavy, and traveling very fast.
27.title: Method and apparatus for using a katana to defend against a spear-wielding assailant
27.abstract: A method of defending against a spear-wielding assailant is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) positioning one's body so as to be able to swing a katana at an attacker; (b) holding the katana in such a way that its blade points towards the attacker; (c) waiting for the attacker to strike with his spear; (d) when the attacker strikes with his spear, moving the katana out of the way of the spear while simultaneously thrusting the katana into the abdomen of the attacker; and (e) continuing to thrust the katana into the abdomen of the attacker until the attacker falls to the ground unconscious or dead.

28.content: The top surface of the computer is smooth except for a fisheye lens, a polished glass dome with a purplish optical coating. Whenever Hiro is using the machine, this lens emerges and clicks into place, its base flush with the surface of the computer. The neighborhood loglo is curved and foreshortened on its surface. Hiro finds it erotic.
28.title: Computer with fisheye lens
28.abstract: A computer includes a display, a camera, and a processor. The display is configured to display an image of a user interacting with the computer. The camera is configured to capture one or more images of the environment in which the computer is located. The processor is coupled to the display and the camera. The processor is configured to cause the display to display at least some of the one or more images captured by the camera from a perspective that simulates a fisheye lens while also displaying the image of the user interacting with the computer.

29.content: Scott Lagerquist is standing right on the edge of Mark Norman's 24/7 Motorcycle Mall, waiting, when the man with the swords comes into view, striding down the sidewalk. A pedestrian is a peculiar sight in L.A., considerably more peculiar than a man with swords. But a welcome one. Anyone who drives out to a motorcycle dealership already has a car, by definition, so it's hard to give them a really hard sell.
29.title: Motorcycle mall
29.abstract: A motorcycle mall is disclosed. The motorcycle mall includes a plurality of parking spaces for storing motorcycles, wherein each one of the plurality of parking spaces comprises at least one sensor configured to detect an object located in the corresponding parking space; and a control unit coupled to the plurality of sensors such that the control unit receives data from the plurality of sensors indicative of objects stored in the plurality of parking spaces.

30.content: “This happened very late in the war,” Hiro says, “and this camp was just outside of Nagasaki.” The businessman chokes, reddens, nearly loses it. His left hand reaches up to grip the scabbard of his sword. Hiro looks around; suddenly they are in the center of an open circle of people some ten yards across. “Do you think that the manner in which you came to possess these swords was honorable?” the businessman says. “If I did not, I would long since have returned them,” Hiro says.
30.title: Sword of the samurai
30.abstract: A sword comprising a blade and a hilt, wherein the hilt is configured to be gripped by a user's hand. The hilt includes a handle portion having a first end and a second end opposite the first end; an upper guard portion coupled to the handle portion between the first end and the second end; a lower guard portion coupled to the handle portion between the first end and the second end; and a pommel portion coupled to the handle portion between the first end and the second end such that the pommel portion protrudes distally from at least one of the upper guard portion or the lower guard portion.

31.content: “The technical term is ‘glossolalia,' ” the Librarian says. “Technical term? Why bother to have a technical term for a religious ritual?” The Librarian raises his eyebrows. “Oh, there's a great deal of technical literature on the subject. It is a neurological phenomenon that is merely exploited in religious rituals.”
31.title: Method and apparatus for inducing glossolalia
31.abstract: A method of inducing glossolalia in a subject includes presenting the subject with an audio signal comprising one or more tones, wherein each tone is associated with at least one syllable. The method also includes determining whether the subject exhibits signs of glossolalia during presentation of the audio signal. If the subject exhibits signs of glossolalia during presentation of the audio signal, then the method further includes providing feedback to the subject indicating that the subject has exhibited signs of glossolalia. Otherwise, if the subject does not exhibit signs of glossolalia during presentation of the audio signal, then the method further includes terminating presentation of the audio signal without providing feedback to the subject.

32.content: L. Bob Rife has taken xenoglossia and perfected it, turned it into a science. “He can control these people by grafting radio receivers into their skulls, broadcasting instructions—me—directly into their brainstems. If one person in a hundred has a receiver, he can act as the local en and distribute the me of L. Bob Rife to all the others. They will act out L. Bob Rife's instructions as though they have been programmed to.
32.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for mind-controlled zombie army of L. Bob Rife.
32.abstract: A method includes receiving an input from a user to activate a virtual reality (VR) game in which the user controls one or more avatars within a VR environment. The method further includes detecting that the user has fallen asleep while playing the VR game. In response to detecting that the user has fallen asleep while playing the VR game, the method includes deactivating at least one of the one or more avatars controlled by the user during play of the VR game. Additionally, upon detecting that the user has woken up, the method includes reactivating control of the at least one of the one or more avatars so that the user can resume playing the VR game.

33.content: Y.T. gets up and walks around behind his desk to look. Each of the little TV monitors is showing a different view out his van: windshield, left window, right window, rearview. Another one has an electronic map showing his position: inbound on the San Bernardino, not far away. “The van is under voice command,” he explains. “I removed the steering-wheel-and-pedal interface because I found verbal commands more convenient. This is why I will sometimes make unfamiliar sounds with my voice—I am controlling the vehicle's systems.”
33.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on computer storage media, for voice-controlled self-driving vehicles. One of the methods includes receiving, from a user, a request to initiate a self-driv
33.abstract: Method(s), systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on computer storage media, for voice-controlled self-driving vehicles. One of the methods includes receiving, from a user, a request to initiate a self-driving mode of an autonomous vehicle (AV) in which the AV is configured to drive itself without human intervention; determining that one or more preconditions have been satisfied; responsive to determining that the one or more preconditions have been satisfied, causing the AV to enter the self-driving mode; while the AV is operating in the self-driving mode, receiving, from the user, at least one spoken command associated with controlling operation of the AV during the self-driving mode; and responding to receiving the at least one spoken command by executing the at least one spoken command. Various other aspects are described in greater detail herein.

34.content: Stunningly beautiful women, computer-airbrushed and retouched at seventy-two frames a second, like Playboy pinups turned three-dimensional—these are would-be actresses hoping to be discovered. Wild-looking abstracts, tornadoes of gyrating light—hackers who are hoping that Da5id will notice their talent, invite them inside, give them a job. A liberal sprinkling of black-and-white people—persons who are accessing the Metaverse through cheap public terminals, and who are rendered in jerky, grainy black and white. A lot of these are run-of-the-mill psycho fans, devoted to the fantasy of stabbing some particular actress to death; they can't even get close in Reality, so they goggle into the Metaverse to stalk their prey. There are would-be rock stars done up in laser light, as though they just stepped off the concert stage, and the avatars of Nipponese businessmen, exquisitely rendered by their fancy equipment, but utterly reserved and boring in their suits. There's one black-and-white who stands out because he's taller than the rest. The Street protocol states that your avatar can't be any taller than you are. This is to prevent people from walking around a mile high. Besides, if this guy's using a pay terminal—which he must be, to judge from the image quality—it can't jazz up his avatar.
34.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for avatars in the metaverse
34.abstract: Implementations of methods, systems, and computer-readable media for avatars in the metaverse are described herein. In an example implementation, a method may include receiving one or more inputs from a first user device associated with a first user; determining that the first user is participating in a virtual reality (VR) session using a second user device associated with a second user; identifying at least one VR object being used by the first user during the VR session; generating an avatar model corresponding to the at least one VR object; storing the avatar model in a database; associating the avatar model stored in the database with both the first user and the second user; and transmitting the avatar model stored in the database to each of the first user device and the second user device. Other implementations are also disclosed herein.

35.content: Everyone else had to use their higher brains and figure it out. So you might say that the nam-shub of Enki was the beginnings of human consciousness—when we first had to think for ourselves. It was the beginning of rational religion, too, the first time that people began to think about abstract issues like God and Good and Evil. That's where the name Babel comes from. Literally it means ‘Gate of God.' It was the gate that allowed God to reach the human race. Babel is a gateway in our minds, a gateway that was opened by the nam-shub of Enki that broke us free from the metavirus and gave us the ability to think—moved us from a materialistic world to a dualistic world—a binary world—with both a physical and a spiritual component. “There was probably chaos and upheaval. Enki, or his son Marduk, tried to reimpose order on society by supplanting the old system of me with a code of laws—The Code of Hammurabi. It was partially successful.
35.title:
Systems and methods for determining the origin of human consciousness based on the Nam-Shub of Enki.
Method:A method for determining the origin of human consciousness based on the Nam-Shub of Enki
35.abstract: The system includes a processor configured to execute instructions stored in non-transitory computer readable media, wherein execution of the instructions by the processor causes the processor to perform operations. The operations include receiving one or more inputs from an input device; processing the one or more inputs using at least one artificial neural network (ANN), wherein the at least one ANN processes the one or more inputs into electrical pulses that are indicative of brainwaves associated with cognitive activity occurring within a subject's cerebral cortex; analyzing the electrical pulses processed by the at least one ANN to determine whether the subject is awake or asleep; responsive to determining that the subject is awake, comparing the electrical pulses processed by the at least one ANN to pre-stored electrical pulses corresponding to different states of consciousness experienced by other subjects; identifying which state of consciousness corresponds to the elect

36.content: “Which blows universalism out of the water.” “Not necessarily. They explain this problem by saying that the shared traits are too deeply buried to be analyzable.” “Which is a cop out.” “Their point is that at some level, language has to happen inside the human brain. Since all human brains are more or less the same—” “The hardware's the same. Not the software.” “You are using some kind of metaphor that I cannot understand.” Hiro whips past a big Airstream that is rocking from side to side in a dangerous wind coming down the valley. “Well, a French-speaker's brain starts out the same as an English-speaker's brain. As they grow up, they get programmed with different software—they learn different languages.” “Yes. Therefore, according to the universalists, French and English—or any other languages—must share certain traits that have their roots in the ‘deep structures' of the human brain. According to Chomskyan theory, the deep structures are innate components of the brain that enable it to carry out certain formal kinds of operations on strings of symbols. Or, as Steiner paraphrases Emmon Bach: These deep structures eventually lead to the actual patterning of the cortex with its immensely ramified yet, at the same time, ‘programmed' network of electrochemical and neurophysiological channels.” “But these deep structures are so deep we can't even see them?” “The universalists place the active nodes of linguistic life—the deep structures—so deep as to defy observation and description. Or to use Steiner's analogy: Try to draw up the creature from the depths of the sea, and it will disintegrate or change form grotesquely.”
36.title: Method and apparatus for determining which blows universalism out of the water; and method and apparatus for determining which blows universalism out of the water
36.abstract: A computer-implemented method for determining which blows universalism out of the water is provided. The method includes receiving, by one or more processors coupled to memory, input data comprising at least one parameter associated with each of a plurality of wind turbine generators (WTGs) in a WTG farm. The method further includes generating, by the one or more processors using the received input data, a first probability distribution function (PDF) corresponding to an expected power output of the WTG farm over a predetermined period of time. The method further includes generating, by the one or more processors using the received input data, a second PDF corresponding to an actual power output of the WTG farm over the predetermined period of time. The method further includes computing, by the one or more processors using the first PDF and the second PDF, a cumulative difference between the expected power output and the actual power

37.content: Tranny shows Hiro how to snap the zodiac's oars into the oarlocks. Hiro rows for a while and finds himself in a long clear zone that zigzags its way through the Raft, like a lead of clear water between ice floes in the Arctic. “Motor okay,” Tranny says. He drops the motor into the water. Tranny pumps up the fuel line and starts it up. It starts on the first pull; Bruce Lee ran a tight ship. As Hiro begins to motor down the open space, he is afraid that it is just a little cove in the ghetto. But this is just a trick of the lights. He rounds a corner and finds it stretching out for some distance. It is a sort of beltway that runs all the way around the Raft. Small streets and even smaller alleys lead from this beltway into the various ghettos. Through the scope, Hiro can see that their entrances are guarded.
37.title: Zodiac raft
37.abstract: A zodiac raft includes an inflatable tube, and at least two air chambers disposed within the inflatable tube. Each of the at least two air chambers is configured to be independently inflated or deflated.

38.content: The Deliverator's car has enough potential energy packed into its batteries to fire a pound of bacon into the Asteroid Belt. Unlike a bimbo box or a Burb beater, the Deliverator's car unloads that power through gaping, gleaming, polished sphincters.
38.title: Apparatus and method for transporting a deliverator's car
38.abstract: A delivery apparatus includes a vehicle configured to be driven by the deliverator. The vehicle is equipped with at least one of an electric motor, a combustion engine, or a hybrid combination thereof. A trailer is coupled to the vehicle such that the trailer is movable relative to the vehicle between a first position and a second position. In the first position, the trailer stores the deliverator's car. In the second position, the trailer transports the deliverator's car behind the vehicle.

39.content: She leans away from it, leans into a vicious turn, her spokes grip the pavement and push her away from that gravestone, she can touch the pavement with one hand she is heeled over so hard, the spokes push her onto the desired street. Meanwhile, she has clicked off the electromagnetic force that held her pooned to the van. The poon head comes loose, caroms off the pavement behind her as it is automatically reeled in to reunite with the handle.
39.title: Systems and methods for retrieving a poon head from a van
39.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for retrieving a poon head from a van. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an indication that a poon head is to be retrieved from a van by a robotic arm located in the van. The method also includes moving the robotic arm into position relative to the poon head such that the robotic arm is configured to retrieve the poon head from the van. Additionally, the method includes actuating the robotic arm to retrieve the poon head from the van. Numerous other aspects are also contemplated.

40.content: So we go for an extraction.” “Extraction of what?” “Of Y.T.” “I go along with that,” Hiro says, “but I have another person I want to extract also, as long as we're extracting.”
40.title: Method and apparatus for extracting Y.T.
40.abstract: Provided are a method and an apparatus for extracting Y.T. The method comprises the following steps: S1, obtaining at least one image; S2, inputting the at least one image into a pre-trained deep learning model to obtain feature information of each pixel in the at least one image; S3, performing edge detection processing on the feature information of each pixel in the at least one image by using the feature information of each pixel in the at least one image obtained from the pre-trained deep learning model so as to obtain first edge information; S4, calculating second edge information according to the first edge information; S5, determining whether the second edge information meets a predetermined condition or not; and S6, when it is determined that the second edge information meets the predetermined condition, outputting position information corresponding to the point where the second edge information meets the predetermined condition as Y.T.

41.content: He uploads it to the CIC database—the Library, formerly the Library of Congress, but no one calls it that anymore. Most people are not entirely clear on what the word “congress” means. And even the word “library” is getting hazy. It used to be a place full of books, mostly old ones. Then they began to include videotapes, records, and magazines. Then all of the information got converted into machine-readable form, which is to say, ones and zeroes. And as the number of media grew, the material became more up to date, and the methods for searching the Library became more and more sophisticated
41.title: Method and apparatus for storing and retrieving data from a computerized information collection and indexing system (CICIS)
41.abstract: A method of operating a Computerized Information Collection and Indexing System (CICIS) is disclosed. The CICIS includes a plurality of servers, each server including at least one processor configured to execute instructions stored in non-transitory memory coupled to the at least one processor that instructs the at least one processor to perform operations comprising receiving an input file; determining whether the input file has previously been processed by the CICIS; responsive to a determination that the input file has not previously been processed by the CICIS, processing the input file according to predetermined rules associated with the CICIS; and responsive to a determination that the input file has previously been processed by the CICIS, updating metadata associated with the input file without reprocessing the input file. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

42.content: So the user can't get back in until his avatar has been disposed of. Disposal of hacked-up avatars is taken care of by Graveyard Daemons, a new Metaverse feature that Hiro had to invent. They are small lithe persons swathed in black, like ninjas, not even their eyes showing. They are quiet and efficient. Even as Hiro is stepping back from the hacked-up body of his former opponent, they are emerging from invisible trapdoors in The Black Sun's floor, climbing up out of the netherworld, converging on the fallen businessman. Within seconds, they have stashed the body parts into black bags. Then they climb back down through their secret trapdoors and vanish into hidden tunnels beneath The Black Sun's floor. A couple of curious patrons try to follow them, try to pry open the trapdoors, but their avatars' fingers find nothing but smooth matte black.
42.title: Method and system for disposing of hacked-up avatars
42.abstract: The present invention relates to the field of virtual reality (VR) games. More specifically, the present invention provides a method and system for disposing of hacked-up avatars that can be used in any type of VR game.

43.content: So she'll have to stop at the off-ramp and wait hours and hours for a ride. A ramp turd.
43.title: Apparatus and method for providing a ramp turd
43.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed herein. In one embodiment, an apparatus comprises at least one light source configured to emit infrared (IR) light in a first wavelength range; at least one detector configured to detect IR light in a second wavelength range different from the first wavelength range; at least one processor coupled to the at least one light source and the at least one detector, wherein the at least one processor is configured to control the at least one light source to emit the IR light in the first wavelength range such that the emitted IR light substantially scatters away from the at least one detector so as to prevent detection of the emitted IR light by the at least one detector while simultaneously controlling the at least one light source to emit the IR light in the first wavelength range such that the emitted IR light is detected by the at

44.content: None of this three-dimensional stuff, no goggles, no stereo sound. The computers are all basic flat-screen two-dimensional numbers. Windows appear on the desktop, with little text documents inside. All part of the austerity program. Soon to reap major benefits. She signs on and checks her mail. No personal mail, just a couple of mass-distributed pronouncements from Marietta. NEW TP POOL REGULATIONS I've been asked to distribute the new regulations regarding office pool displays. The enclosed memo is a new subchapter of the EBGOC Procedure Manual, replacing the old subchapter entitled PHYSICAL PLANT/CALIFORNIA/LOS ANGELES/BUILDINGS/OFFICE AREAS/PHYSICAL LAYOUT REGULATIONS/EMPLOYEE INPUT/GROUP ACTIVITIES. The old subchapter was a flat prohibition on the use of office space or time for “pool” activities of any kind, whether permanent (e.g., coffee pool) or one-time (e.g., birthday parties).
44.title: Three-dimensional office pool
44.abstract: A three-dimensional (3D) office pool is provided. The 3D office pool comprises an enclosure, wherein the enclosure has at least one sidewall and a floor; a plurality of cubbyholes disposed within the enclosure, each of the plurality of cubbyholes having a respective front wall, a respective back wall, a respective top wall, and a respective bottom wall that are substantially parallel to the floor when viewed from above in a direction perpendicular to the front wall or the back wall so as to form a rectilinear prismatic volume; and a plurality of betting slips corresponding to the plurality of cubbyholes, respectively. Each of the plurality of betting slips may be configured to allow a user to place a wager on which of the plurality of cubbyholes will contain a selected object during a predetermined time period

The rendering is so perfect that Y.T. can see a miniaturized reflection of the office windows in each drop of condensation. It's just totally ostentatious. What a bithead. He is looking at her with a totally emotionless face, but Y.T. imagines that it is a face of hate and disgust.

The apparatus (100) comprises at least one light source (102a-102n), wherein each light source (102a-102n) emits collimated light beams (104a-104n). The apparatus (100) further comprises a plurality of lenses (106a-106n), wherein each lens (106a-106n) is configured to receive a respective collimated light beam (104a-104n) from a respective light source (102a-102n) and focus the respective collimated light beam (104a-10

46.content: But from a modern standpoint, semen is just a carrier of information—both benevolent sperm and malevolent viruses. Enki's water—his semen, his data, his me—flow throughout the country of Sumer and cause it to flourish.” “As you may be aware, Sumer existed on the flood-plain between two major rivers, the Tigris and the Euphrates.
46.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for detecting sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) in ancient Mesopotamia. In some implementations, a method includes obtaining a
46.abstract: method of determining the presence or absence of an STD in a biological specimen obtained from a patient at a particular point in time is provided. The method includes identifying one or more nucleic acids present in the biological specimen that are indicative of the presence of the STD; amplifying the one or more nucleic acids to generate multiple copies of the one or more nucleic acids; sequencing the multiple copies of the one or more nucleic acids to produce sequence data representative of the one or more nucleic acids; analyzing the sequence data to determine whether the STD was present in the biological specimen at the particular point in time; and outputting information indicating whether the STD was present in the biological specimen at the particular point in time. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

47.content: Talking to a black-and-white on the Street is like talking to a person who has his face stuck in a xerox machine, repeatedly pounding the copy button, while you stand by the output tray pulling the sheets out one at a time and looking at them. He has long hair, parted in the middle like a curtain to reveal a tattoo on his forehead. Given the shitty resolution, there's no way to see the tattoo clearly, but it appears to consist of words.
47.title: Black-and-white copier with tattooed forehead
47.abstract: A black-and-white copier is provided. The black-and-white copier includes a main body, a plurality of first rollers and a plurality of second rollers which are arranged in the main body to form a nip therebetween for conveying an original between the first rollers and the second rollers, wherein at least one of the first rollers or the second rollers has a surface that is coated with a material having a glossy property so as to be capable of reflecting light emitted from the original when the original is conveyed through the nip by the first rollers and the second rollers.

48.content: They formalized their old stories into the Torah and implanted within it a law that insured its propagation throughout history—a law that said, in effect, ‘make an exact copy of me and read it every day.' And they encouraged a sort of informational hygiene, a belief in copying things strictly and taking great care with information, which as they understood, is potentially dangerous. They made data a controlled substance. “They may have gone beyond that. There is evidence of carefully planned biological warfare against the army of Sennacherib when he tried to conquer Jerusalem. So the deuteronomists may have had an en of their very own. Or maybe they just understood viruses well enough that they knew how to take advantage of naturally occurring strains. The skills cultivated by these people were passed down in secret from one generation to the next and manifested themselves two thousand years later, in Europe, among the kabbalistic sorcerers, ba'al shems, masters of the divine name. “In any case, this was the birth of rational religion. All of the subsequent monotheistic religions—known by Muslims, appropriately, as religions of the Book—incorporated those ideas to some extent.
48.title:
Apparatus and method for providing a deuteronomist and a birth of rational religion

48.abstract: disclosed. The apparatus includes a communication module configured to receive an input from a user, a storage configured to store information related to at least one book selected by the user in response to the input received through the communication module, and a control module configured to generate text corresponding to the at least one book selected by the user among the plurality of books stored in the storage using artificial intelligence (AI), wherein the generated text corresponds to contents included in the at least one book selected by the user out of the plurality of books stored in the storage.

49.content: That is good, that means high turnover for him, fast action, keep moving that 'za. As he scrunches to a stop, the electromechanical hatch on the flank of his car is already opening to reveal his empty pizza slots, the door clicking and folding back in on itself like the wing of a beetle. The slots are waiting. Waiting for hot pizza. And waiting. The Deliverator honks his horn. This is not a nominal outcome. Window slides open.
49.title: Systems and methods for delivering pizza
49.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for ordering, preparing, and delivering food items. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an order request from a user device associated with a first customer; determining whether there is sufficient inventory to fulfill the order request; in response to determining that there is insufficient inventory to fulfill the order request, identifying at least one ingredient needed to complete the order request; retrieving pricing information corresponding to the at least one ingredient; calculating a total price by summing the pricing information for the at least one ingredient; transmitting the total price to the user device; receiving acceptance of the total price from the user device; and initiating preparation of the ordered food item. Other implementations are also described herein.

50.content: In other words, once the Metaverse began to fill up with obstacles that you could run into, the job of traveling across it at high speed suddenly became more interesting. Maneuverability became an issue. Size became an issue. Hiro and Da5id and the rest of them began to switch away from the enormous, bizarre vehicles they had favored at first—Victorian houses on tank treads, rolling ocean liners, mile-wide crystalline spheres, flaming chariots drawn by dragons—in favor of small maneuverable vehicles. Motorcycles, basically. A Metaverse vehicle can be as fast and nimble as a quark.
50.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for motorcycles in the metaverse
50.abstract: Implementations of methods, systems, and computer-readable media for motorcycles in the metaverse are described. In one implementation, a method is performed by at least one computing device that includes accessing an interactive virtual environment (IVE) comprising a plurality of avatars associated with respective user devices; determining whether a request has been received to spawn a motorcycle within the IVE; spawning the motorcycle within the IVE upon determining that the request has been received; controlling movement of the motorcycle within the IVE responsive to input provided from any of the plurality of avatars via their respective user devices; and transmitting data indicative of movements of the motorcycle within the IVE to each of the plurality of avatars via their respective user devices. Numerous other implementations are also described.

51.content: This is doable. He cranks up the orange warning lights to maximum brilliance, puts his headlights on autoflash. He overrides the warning buzzer, jams the stereo over to Taxiscan, which cruises all the taxi-driver frequencies listening for interesting traffic. Can't understand a fucking word. You could buy tapes, learn-while-you-drive, and learn to speak Taxilinga. It was essential, to get a job in that business. They said it was based on English but not one word in a hundred was recognizable. Still, you could get an idea. If there was trouble on this road, they'd be babbling about it in Taxilinga, give him some warning, let him take an alternate route so he wouldn't get he grips the wheel stuck in traffic his eyes get big, he can feel the pressure driving them back into his skull or caught behind a mobile home his bladder is very full and deliver the pizza Oh, God oh, God late 22:06 hangs on the windshield; all he can see, all he can think about is 30:01. The taxi drivers are buzzing about something.
51.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for facilitating taxi rides. In some implementations, a method includes receiving, from a user device of a user, a request to
51.abstract: implement a transportation service between a pickup location and a drop-off location; identifying one or more vehicles that are available to implement the transportation service; determining an estimated cost associated with implementing the transportation service using at least one of the one or more vehicles; in accordance with a determination that the estimated cost is less than a predetermined threshold amount, transmitting instructions to cause implementation of the transportation service using the at least one of the one or more vehicles; providing access to funds corresponding to a portion of the estimated cost determined to be owed to the user as a result of implementing the transportation service via the at least one of the one or more vehicles; obtaining feedback regarding performance of the at least one of the one or more vehicles during implementation of the transportation service; and adjusting a ranking of the at least one of the one or more vehicles based on the feedback. Implementations may include various other aspects.

52.content: Y.T. surfs through traffic jams for a living. That's her economic niche: beating the traffic. And she knows that a car doesn't boil over when it is speeding down an open freeway.
52.title: Surfing through traffic jams for a living
52.abstract: A method of surfing through traffic jams for a living is provided. The method includes detecting, by an autonomous vehicle (AV), one or more obstacles in the path of the AV and determining that the AV will collide with at least one of the one or more obstacles within a predetermined amount of time. In response to determining that the AV will collide with at least one of the one or more obstacles within the predetermined amount of time, the AV may be configured to decelerate from a first speed to a second speed less than the first speed prior to colliding with the at least one of the one or more obstacles such that the AV avoids collision with the at least one of the one or more obstacles while traveling at the second speed.

53.content: “Snow Crash penetrates the walls of brain cells and goes to the nucleus where the DNA is stored. So for purposes of this mission, we developed a detector that would enable us to find cell wall-penetrating compounds in the air.
53.title: Detection of cell wall-penetrating compounds
53.abstract: The present invention relates to the detection of cell wall-penetrating compounds. In particular, the present invention relates to methods and compositions for detecting cell wall-penetrating compounds such as bacteriophage lytic enzymes (e.g., phage endolysins).

54.content: It's pretty obvious which warehouse we are looking for here. Fourth one on the left, the road that runs down toward the waterfront is blocked off by several shipping containers—the big steel boxes you see on the backs of eighteen-wheelers. They are arranged in a herringbone pattern, so that in order to get past them you have to slalom back and forth half a dozen times, passing through a narrow mazelike channel between high walls of steel. Guys with guns are perched on top, looking down at Y.T. as she guides her plank through the obstacle course.
54.title: Warehouse 13: A Warehouse 13 adventure for the World of Darkness roleplaying game
54.abstract: A warehouse-thirteen adventure set in the World of Darkness tabletop roleplaying game universe.

55.content: 48 There are four men in the life raft: Hiro Protagonist, self-employed stringer for the Central Intelligence Corporation, whose practice used to be limited to so-called “dry” operations, meaning that he sat around and soaked up information and then later spat it back into the Library, the CIC database, without ever actually doing anything. Now his practice has become formidably wet. Hiro is armed with two swords and a nine-millimeter semiautomatic pistol, known colloquially as a nine, with two ammunition clips, each carrying eleven rounds. Vic, unspecified last name. If there was still such a thing as income tax, then every year when Vic filled out his 1040 form he would put down, as his occupation, “sniper.” In classic sniper style, Vic is reticent, unobtrusive. He is armed with a long, large-caliber rifle with a bulky mechanism mounted on its top, where a telescopic sight might be found if Vic were not at the leading edge of his profession. The exact nature of this device is not obvious, but Hiro presumes that it is an exquisitely precise sensor package with fine crosshairs superimposed on the middle. Vic may safely be presumed to be carrying additional small concealed weapons. Eliot Chung.
55.title: Summary:Method and apparatus for simulating a life raft
55.abstract: A method of simulating a life raft is provided. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication that the life raft has been activated. The method also includes determining, by the computing device, one or more parameters associated with the life raft. The method further includes transmitting, by the computing device, the one or more parameters to at least one other computing device in communication with the computing device. In addition, the method includes generating, by the computing device, a three-dimensional (3D) model of the life raft based on the one or more parameters received from the at least one other computing device. Further, the method includes displaying, by the computing device, the 3D model of the life raft on a graphical user interface (GUI). An apparatus for simulating a life raft is also provided.

56.content: Entire sections of them simply cannot be translated—the characters are legible and well-known, but when put together they do not say anything that leaves an imprint on the modern mind.” “Like instructions for programming a VCR.” “There is a great deal of monotonous repetition. There is also a fair amount of what Lagos described as ‘Rotary Club Boosterism'—scribes extolling the superior virtue of their city over some other city.” “What makes one Sumerian city better than another one? A bigger ziggurat?
56.title: Systems and methods for machine translation of cuneiform tablets
56.abstract: Implementations described herein relate to systems and methods for machine translation of cuneiform tablets. In one implementation, the method includes receiving an image of a cuneiform tablet; identifying characters in the image using optical character recognition (OCR) techniques; translating the identified characters into English or another language by training a machine learning model with labeled data comprising images of cuneiform tablets that have already been translated from cuneiform text to English or another language; and generating a translation of the cuneiform tablet as output.

57.content: Doctors use them for eye surgery—they can cut your cornea and not leave a scar. There's Indians who make a living doing that, you know. Chipping out eye scalpels.” “Well, you learn something new every day.

57.abstract: A surgical blade includes a body having a proximal end, a distal end, and a longitudinal axis extending between the proximal end and the distal end. A cutting edge extends from the proximal end to the distal end at an oblique angle relative to the longitudinal axis.

58.content: The Librarian daemon looks like a pleasant, fiftyish, silver-haired, bearded man with bright blue eyes, wearing a V-neck sweater over a work shirt, with a coarsely woven, tweedy-looking wool tie. The tie is loosened, the sleeves pushed up. Even though he's just a piece of software, he has reason to be cheerful; he can move through the nearly infinite stacks of information in the Library with the agility of a spider dancing across a vast web of cross-references. The Librarian is the only piece of CIC software that costs even more than Earth; the only thing he can't do is think.
58.title: Systems and methods for providing an artificial intelligence (AI) librarian for a cyberintrusion countermeasures (CIC) system
58.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for providing an artificial intelligence (AI) librarian for a cyberintrusion countermeasures (CIC) system. In one implementation, a method includes receiving data from a plurality of sensors in a CIC system; analyzing the received data to identify at least one anomaly within the CIC system; determining whether the at least one anomaly is indicative of a cyberintrusion into the CIC system; if it is determined that the at least one anomaly is indicative of a cyberintrusion into the CIC system, identifying remedial actions associated with mitigating or eliminating the cyberintrusion; and transmitting the identified remedial actions to be executed by components of the CIC system.

59.content: Extremely thick, wide leather straps have been stretched across the head and foot of the bed. Leather cuffs, lined with fluffy sheepskin, are attached to the straps. These cuffs have been fastened around Da5id's wrists and ankles.

Each strap has a first end secured to the underside of the mattress and a second end positioned above the top surface of the mattress.

The media image of the Raft is that it is a place of utter chaos, where thousands of different languages are spoken and there is no central authority.

Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

62.content: She puts the heel of one hand against the edge of the clay tablet and shoves as hard as she can. It slides across the floor, teeters on the threshold, and spins out of the chopper. Another delivery made, another satisfied customer. 61 For a minute or so, the chopper hovers twenty feet over-head. All the people inside are staring down at the tablet, which has burst out of its wrappings in the middle of the bullseye. The plastic has torn apart around the corners and fragments—large fragments—of the tablet have sprayed out for a few feet in either direction. Hiro stares at it, too, still safe behind the cover of a parked chopper. He stares at it so hard that he forgets to stare at anything else. Then a couple of wireheads land on his back, smashing his face into the flank of the chopper.

The clay tablet delivery system further includes an enclosure, wherein each clay tablet in the plurality of clay tablets is disposed within the enclosure.

They all had the same moms with the same generous buttocks in stretchy slacks and the same frosted-and-curling-ironed hairdos, and they were all basically sweet and endearing and conforming and, if they happened to be smart, they went out of their way to hide it. So the first time Hiro saw Juanita, or any other girl like her, his perspectives were bent all out of shape.
