Based on the comparison, the computing device determines whether the subject is carrying a particular type of firearm. Other embodiments are also described herein.

186.content: Y.T. is not a computer person, but she knows that somewhere behind the cabinets and doors in the back of this truck there is a big computer doing a lot of things right now. “It's like a CAT scanner,” the man with the glass eye says, using the same hushed tone of voice as a sports-caster in a golfing tournament. “But it reads everything, you know,” he says, rotating his hands impatiently in all-encompassing circles. “How much does it cost?” “I don't know.” “What's it called?” “Doesn't really have a name yet.” “Well, who makes it?” “We made the goddamn thing,” the man with the glass eye says.
186.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and diagnosing faults in a vehicle
186.abstract: A diagnostic apparatus (100) is configured to be coupled to an electronic control unit (ECU) of a vehicle, the ECU comprising at least one hardware component. The diagnostic apparatus (100) comprises a processor (102), wherein the processor (102) is configured to receive data from the ECU via a communication interface (104). The processor (102) is further configured to analyse the received data with respect to predetermined patterns indicative of different types of faults that may occur in the at least one hardware component; and determine whether or not a fault has occurred in the at least one hardware component by analysing the received data with respect to said predetermined patterns.

187.content: Cuts through the middle of Fedland, where her mother goes to work every day. Fedland used to be the VA Hospital and a bunch of other Federal buildings; now it has condensed into a kid ney-shaped lozenge that wraps around 405. It has a barrier around it, a perimeter fence put up by stringing chain link fabric, concertina wire, heaps of rubble, and Jersey barriers from one building to the next.
187.title: Method and apparatus for securing a perimeter fence
187.abstract: A method of securing a perimeter fence is disclosed. The method comprises detecting an intrusion into the perimeter fence; determining whether the detected intrusion has breached the perimeter fence; in response to determining that the detected intrusion has not breached the perimeter fence, activating at least one light emitting diode (LED) associated with the perimeter fence such that the LED(s) are operable to provide illumination around the perimeter fence; and in response to determining that the detected intrusion has breached the perimeter fence, transmitting a message to a remote monitoring device via a cellular network. An apparatus for securing a perimeter fence is also disclosed. A system for securing a perimeter fence is also disclosed.

188.content: One part of her is dispassionately watching the head bounce and spin in the dust, and the other part of her is screaming her lungs out. She hears a crack, the first loud noise so far. She turns to follow the sound, looking in the direction of a water tower that looms above this area, providing a fine vantage point for a sniper. But then her attention is drawn by the pencil-thin blue-white exhaust of a tiny rocket that lances up into the sky from Ng's van. It doesn't do anything; it just goes up to a certain height and hovers, sitting on its exhaust.
188.title: Method and apparatus for launching an object into the atmosphere
188.abstract: A method of launching an object into the atmosphere includes receiving, by a computing device, a request to launch an object into the atmosphere; determining, by the computing device, a first set of one or more atmospheric conditions associated with a first location in the atmosphere; determining, by the computing device, a second set of one or more atmospheric conditions associated with a second location in the atmosphere; calculating, by the computing device, a difference between the first set of one or more atmospheric conditions and the second set of one or more atmospheric conditions; comparing, by the computing device, the calculated difference to a predetermined threshold value; and transmitting, by the computing device, a command to launch the object into the atmosphere when the calculated difference is greater than the predetermined threshold value. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

189.content: Hiro turns around. It's a big porky white man with wavy, slicked-back red hair and a beard. He's got a baseball cap perched on top of his head, tilted way back to expose the following words, tattooed in block letters across his forehead: MOOD SWINGS RACIALLY INSENSITIVE Hiro is looking up at all of this over the curving horizon of the man's flannel-clad belly. “What is it?” Hiro says. “Well, sir, I'm sorry to disturb you in the middle of your conversation with this gentleman here.

190.content: If you are some peon who does not own a House, for example, a person who is coming in from a public terminal, then you materialize in a Port. There are 256 Express Ports on the street, evenly spaced around its circumference at intervals of 256 kilometers. Each of these intervals is further subdivided 256 times with Local Ports, spaced exactly one kilometer apart (astute students of hacker semiotics will note the obsessive repetition of the number 256, which is 28 power—and even that 8 looks pretty juicy, dripping with 22 additional 2s). The Ports serve a function analogous to airports: This is where you drop into the Metaverse from somewhere else. Once you have materialized in a Port, you can walk down the Street or hop on the monorail or whatever.

The method comprises detecting, by one or more sensors associated with the user device, at least one physical object in proximity to the user device; determining whether the at least one physical object corresponds to a predetermined type of physical object; responsive to determining that the at least one physical object corresponds to the predetermined type of physical object, obtaining location information relating to the at least one physical object; transmitting the location information from the user device to a remote server via a communication network; receiving, by the user device from the remote server via the communication network, data indicative of content corresponding to the at least one physical object; and presenting, by the user device, the data indicative of the content superimposed relative to a view of the at least one physical object as captured by the one or more sensors. 191.title: Apparatus and method for securing a weapon to a protective garment
191.abstract: A system is provided for securing a weapon to a protective garment worn by a user. The system also includes a strap having a proximal end and a distal end, wherein the proximal end of the strap is coupled to the sleeve such that the strap extends through at least one of the plurality of openings in the sleeve between the proximal end and the distal end.

192.content: You can have it now.” He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a hypercard. It looks like a business card. The hypercard is an avatar of sorts. It is used in the Metaverse to represent a chunk of data. It might be text, audio, video, a still image, or any other information that can be represented digitally. Think of a baseball card, which carries a picture, some text, and some numerical data. A baseball hypercard could contain a highlight film of the player in action, shown in perfect high-def television; a complete biography, read by the player himself, in stereo digital sound; and a complete statistical database along with specialized software to help you look up the numbers you want. A hypercard can carry a virtually infinite amount of information. For all Hiro knows, this hypercard might contain all the books in the Library of Congress, or every episode of Hawaii Five-O that was ever filmed, or the complete recordings of Jimi Hendrix, or the 1950 Census. Or—more likely—a wide variety of nasty computer viruses. If Hiro reaches out and takes the hypercard, then the data it represents will be transferred from this guy's system into Hiro's computer.
192.title: Method and apparatus for transferring data between computing devices
192.abstract: A method of transferring data from a first computing device to a second computing device is disclosed. The method comprises receiving, at the first computing device, an indication that one or more files have been selected for sharing with the second computing device. The method further comprises transmitting, by the first computing device in response to receipt of the indication, metadata associated with the one or more files to the second computing device.

193.title: Apparatus and method for locating a person in a building
193.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for locating a person in a building. In one embodiment, the system includes a plurality of beacons positioned at different locations within a building to provide wireless coverage throughout the building. Each beacon transmits a signal that is received by an electronic device carried by a person moving through the building. The location of each beacon can be determined using triangulation or trilateration techniques from signals received by the electronic device as the person moves through the building.

197.content: About thirty seconds into the kiss, he bends down, wraps his great thigh-sized forearms around her waist, cinches her up into the air, lifting her feet up off the deck. She was afraid he would take her to some horrible place, but it turns out he rented a whole shipping container, stacked way up high on one of the containerships in the Core. The place is like a luxury hotel for big Core wheels. She's trying to decide what to do with her legs, which are now dangling uselessly.

Eliot shrugs. “Twenty miles.”

The first acoustic receiver is configured to receive reflected acoustic waves from the body of water. The second acoustic receiver is configured to receive reflected acoustic waves from the body of water. The third acoustic receiver

199.content: So the Sumerians built towers ‘with their tops with the heavens'—topped with astronomical diagrams. The en would watch the skies and dispense the agricultural me at the proper times of year to keep the economy running.” “I think you have a chicken-and-egg problem,” Uncle Enzo says. “How did such a society first come to be organized?” “There is an informational entity known as the metavirus, which causes information systems to infect themselves with customized viruses. This may be just a basic principle of nature, like Darwinian selection, or it may be an actual piece of information that floats around the universe on comets and radio waves—I'm not sure. In any case, what it comes down to is this: Any information system of sufficient complexity will inevitably become infected with viruses—viruses generated from within itself. “At some point in the distant past, the metavirus infected the human race and has been with us ever since. The first thing it did was to spawn a whole Pandora's box of DNA viruses—smallpox, influenza, and so on.
199.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and mitigating viral infections in an information system
199.abstract: A method of detecting and mitigating viral infections in an information system, the method comprising: (a) obtaining one or more data samples from at least one computing device within the information system; (b) analyzing the one or more data samples using a machine learning model to determine whether there is evidence of a cyber-attack that may be associated with a viral infection; and (c) responsive to determining that there is evidence of a cyber-attack that may be associated with a viral infection, taking steps to mitigate the viral infection.

Before he disappears into the hatch, he turns toward the wreckage of the Kowloon and holds the harpoon up over his head, a gesture of triumph and a promise all at once.

A canopy is stretched over it to keep out the rain, and big mushroom-shaped hoods stick out of the ground every few feet, exhaling warm air on cold nights.

201.abstract: A method of warming an outdoor seat is provided. The method includes detecting, by a temperature sensor associated with the outdoor seat, a temperature of the outdoor seat; determining whether the temperature of the outdoor seat exceeds a predetermined threshold value; in response to determining that the temperature of the outdoor seat does not exceed the predetermined threshold value, controlling at least one heating element associated with the outdoor seat to heat the outdoor seat such that the temperature of the outdoor seat is maintained below the predetermined threshold value; and in response to determining that the temperature of the outdoor seat exceeds the predetermined threshold value, controlling the at least one heating element associated with the outdoor seat to heat the outdoor seat until the temperature of the outdoor seat drops below the predetermined threshold value.

As for the massage, my body is suspended in an electrocontractive gel that massages me when I need it.
202.title: Electro-mechanical exoskeleton
202.abstract: Structural elements of an electro-mechanical exoskeleton are described. The structural elements may be configured to support the wearer's limbs, torso, and/or trunk in order to enhance mobility for the wearer.

203.content: The trawler is falling off the surface of the water, trying to pull in the entire neighborhood like a black hole. A couple of Filipino men are already out with short knives, hacking at the stuff that webs the neighborhood together, trying to cut loose the parts that can't be salvaged. Hiro buzzes over to a pontoon that is already knee-deep under the water, finds the ropes that connect it to the next pontoon, which is even more deeply submerged, and probes them with his katana.
203.title: Method and apparatus for removing debris from a body of water
203.abstract: A method includes receiving an indication to remove debris from a body of water. The method also includes determining that the debris is located within a predetermined distance from a shoreline of the body of water. The method further includes directing a robotic device toward the shoreline of the body of water in response to determining that the debris is located within the predetermined distance from the shoreline of the body of water. The method additionally includes moving the robotic device along the shoreline of the body of water, wherein the robotic device removes the debris from the body of water as the robotic device moves along the shoreline of the body of water.

204.content: No point in describing the office. No point in even allowing the office to even register on her eyeballs and take up valuable memory space in her brain. Fluorescent lights and partitions with carpet glued to them.
204.title: Systems and methods for managing workplace distractions
204.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing workplace distractions. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an indication that a user is engaged in a first activity at a workstation; determining whether the user is engaged in a second activity different from the first activity while the user is engaged in the first activity; responsive to determining that the user is not engaged in the second activity while the user is engaged in the first activity, generating a notification indicating that the user is engaged in the first activity; and displaying the notification via a display device associated with the workstation. Implementations of the present disclosure also include computer-readable storage mediums encoded with instructions executable by one or more processors to perform the techniques described herein.

205.content: He signs onto Turfnet. A list of jobs scrolls up as usual, not a very long list. Interfranchise activity is way down today, as all the local managers gird, polish, and inspect for the possible arrival of Uncle Enzo. But one of the jobs scrolls up in red letters, a priority job. Priority jobs are a little unusual. A symptom of bad morale and general slipshoddity.
205.title: Systems and methods for managing a lawn care service
205.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for scheduling, dispatching, and monitoring field technicians. In one implementation, a computer-implemented method includes receiving an input from a user device associated with a task to be performed by a field technician at a geographic location; determining that the task has not been completed within a predetermined period of time; in response to determining that the task has not been completed within the predetermined period of time, transmitting instructions to a mobile computing device associated with the field technician directing the field technician to return to the geographic location where the task was previously attempted; while the field technician is returning to the geographic location, capturing images of the geographic location using the mobile computing device; and analyzing the images captured by the mobile computing device to determine whether the task has been completed. Various other aspects are contemplated.

206.content: It has to be written in such a way that other people can't see it, but the real estate software doesn't realize that it's invisible. There are about a hundred little tricks like this that Hiro wouldn't know about if he hadn't been programming avatars for people like Vitaly Chernobyl for the last couple of years. To write a really good invisible avatar from scratch would take a long time, but he puts one together in several hours by recycling bits and pieces of old projects left behind in his computer. Which is how hackers usually do it. While he's doing that, he comes across a rather old folder with some transportation software in it. This is left over from the very old days of the Metaverse, before the Monorail existed, when the only way to get around was to walk or to write a piece of ware that simulated a vehicle. In the early days, when the Metaverse was a featureless black ball, this was a trivial job. Later on, when the Street went up and people started building real estate, it became more complicated. On the Street, you can pass through other people's avatars.
206.title: Method and system for controlling an avatar in a virtual reality environment
206.abstract: A method of controlling an avatar in a virtual reality environment is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) receiving user input from a user; (b) determining whether the user input corresponds to one of a plurality of predetermined gestures; (c) if it is determined that the user input corresponds to one of the plurality of predetermined gestures, identifying which of the plurality of predetermined gestures the user input corresponds to; and (d) controlling movement of the avatar within the virtual reality environment according to the identified gesture.

207.content: For an astonishingly long time, he just stands there and looks at the guy's body. Meanwhile, the airborne cloud of blood is seeking its level, dripping from the hung ceiling, spattering down from shelves behind the bar. A wino sitting there nursing a double shot of vodka shakes and shivers, staring into his glass at the galactic swirl of a trillion red cells dying in the ethanol. Hiro swaps a few long glances with the New South Africans, like everyone in the bar is trying to come to a consensus as to what will happen next.
207.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for blood on the ceiling. In some implementations, blood on the ceiling may be a method that includes obtaining a plurality of images of a

208.content: It must be something new Hiro hasn't heard of before, the McDonald's styrofoam burger box of drug containers. They push through a fire door into another section of the U-Stor-It, which looks the same as the last one (everything looks the same in America, there are no transitions now). Vitaly owns the third locker on the right, a puny 5-by-10 that he is actually using for its intended purpose: storage. Vitaly steps up to the door and commences trying to remember the combination to the padlock, which involves a certain amount of random guessing.
208.title: Apparatus and method for storing and dispensing items
208.abstract: An apparatus for storing and dispensing an item includes a housing having a first end, a second end opposite the first end, and a plurality of sides extending between the first end and the second end. The apparatus also includes at least one door coupled to the housing such that the at least one door is movable between a closed position in which the at least one door substantially closes off the interior of the housing and an open position in which the at least one door provides access to the interior of the housing. The apparatus further includes a shelf disposed within the interior of the housing, wherein the shelf is configured to store the item thereon when the at least one door is in the closed position, and wherein the shelf is configured to be removed from the interior of the housing when the at least one door is in the open position.

209.content: They stomp the cigarettes out on the concrete with their cheap vinyl shoes, run up to the Vanagon, and begin to haul out the sound equipment. Vitaly puts on goggles, hooks himself into a computer on the sound truck, and begins tuning the system. There's a 3-D model of the overpass already in memory. He has to figure out how to sync the delays on all the different speaker clusters to maximize the number of nasty, clashing echoes.

The method comprises the steps of determining (i) at least one frequency band in which it is desirable to generate low-frequency content, (ii) information relating to ambient sound pressure level(s), and (iii) information relating to position(s) of said one or more loudspeaker(s).

210.title: System and method for dispatching emergency responders to an emergency situation
210.abstract: A system and method for dispatching emergency responders to an emergency situation is provided. In one embodiment, the present invention provides a computer-implemented method for dispatching emergency responders to an emergency situation. The method includes obtaining location information associated with at least one user device located within a predetermined proximity of the emergency situation; determining whether any of the at least one user devices are equipped with first responder equipment; if it is determined that none of the at least one user devices are equipped with first responder equipment, transmitting a notification message to all other user devices located within the predetermined proximity of the emergency situation; receiving a response message from at least one user device responsive to the transmission of the notification message; and upon receipt of the response message, instructing the at least one user device to proceed to the emergency situation.

Certain documents are to be hand carried from his office to Nova Sicilia #4649, which is south of downtown.

213.content: Then he leans down so he's looking right into the businessman's face. “Didn't anyone tell you,” he says, losing the dialect, “that I was a hacker?” Then he hacks the guy's head off. It falls to the floor, does a half-roll, and comes to rest staring straight up at the ceiling. So Hiro steps back a couple of paces and mumbles, “Safe.” A largish safe, about a meter on a side, materializes just below the ceiling, plummets, and lands directly on the businessman's head. The impact drives both the safe and the head straight down through the floor of The Black Sun, leaving a square hole in the floor, exposing the tunnel system underneath.
213.title: Method and apparatus for defeating a security system
213.abstract: A method of defeating a security system is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, an image captured by a camera associated with the security system; identifying, by the computing device, one or more features in the image; determining, by the computing device, that the one or more features correspond to a predetermined feature type; generating, by the computing device, at least one fake feature corresponding to the predetermined feature type; and transmitting, by the computing device, the at least one fake feature to the security system so as to cause the security system to be deactivated. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

214.content: It is the kind of coarse and disappointing translation that makes the dismembered bodies of samurai warriors spin in their graves. The word “zanshin” is larded down with a lot of other folderol that you have to be Nipponese to understand. And Hiro thinks, frankly, that most of it is pseudomystical crap, on the same level as his old high school football coach exhorting his men to play at 110 percent. The businessman makes another attack. This one is pretty straightforward: a quick shuffling approach and then a snapping cut in the direction of Hiro's ribcage. Hiro parries it. Now Hiro knows something about this businessman, namely, that like most Nipponese sword fighters, all he knows is kendo. Kendo is to real samurai sword fighting what fencing is to real swashbuckling: an attempt to take a highly disorganized, chaotic, violent, and brutal conflict and turn it into a cute game.
214.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for samurai sword fight. In some implementations, a method includes presenting, in a three-dimensional (3D) environment, a
214.abstract: computer-simulated (3D CG) representation of a samurai swordfight between one or more first avatars and one or more second avatars; determining an outcome of the samurai swordfight by evaluating actions performed by the one or more first avatars and/or the one or more second avatars during the samurai swordfight; causing presentation of at least one visual effect within the 3D environment to indicate the determined outcome of the samurai swordfight; receiving input from a user indicating a desire to replay the samurai swordfight with different parameters than those used to determine the outcome of the samurai swordfight; and responsive to receiving the input, causing presentation of a rerun of the samurai swordfight according to the different parameters. Implementations may also include other features described herein.

215.content: In many parts of the world, you will find people of the same ethnic group, living a few miles apart in similar valleys under similar conditions, speaking languages that have absolutely nothing in common with each other. This sort of thing is not an oddity—it is ubiquitous. Many linguists have tried to understand Babel, the question of why human language tends to fragment, rather than converging on a common tongue.” “Has anyone come up with an answer yet?” “The question is difficult and profound,” the Librarian says. “Lagos had a theory.” “Yes?”

He wanted to isolate this thing and modify it so it could be used to control the programmers without blowing their brains sky high.”
216.title: Method and apparatus for information warfare countermeasures and associated systems and computer-implemented methods therefor
216.abstract: Methods, apparatuses, systems and articles of manufacture are disclosed to perform information warfare countermeasures. An example method may include identifying one or more indicators of compromise (IOCs). The IOCs may be related to an attacker's infrastructure that is being used by the attacker as part of an information warfare campaign directed against at least one target entity. The method may also include determining whether any of the IOCs have been previously identified in association with other entities. Responsive to determining that none of the IOCs have been previously identified in association with other entities, the method may further include performing mitigation actions using the IOCs. Otherwise, the method may include not performing the mitigation actions.

Anywhere life exists, the metavirus is there, too, propagating through it.

218.content: It wasn't until a number of years later, when they both wound up working at Black Sun Systems, Inc., that he put the other half of the equation together. At the time, both of them were working on avatars. He was working on bodies, she was working on faces. She was the face department, because nobody thought that faces were all that important—they were just flesh-toned busts on top of the avatars.
218.title: Apparatus and method for creating an avatar
218.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for creating an avatar. In one embodiment of the present invention, there is provided a computer-implemented method for creating an avatar comprising obtaining at least one image from a plurality of images associated with a user; extracting facial landmarks from the at least one image; determining whether the extracted facial landmarks satisfy predetermined criteria; if the extracted facial landmarks satisfy the predetermined criteria, then associating the at least one image with the avatar; otherwise, repeating until the extracted facial landmarks satisfy the predetermined criteria wherein each time the extracted facial landmarks do not satisfy the predetermined criteria, using another image from the plurality of images to determine whether the extracted facial landmarks satisfy the predetermined criteria.

219.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized use of a vessel
219.abstract: A method is provided for detecting unauthorized use of a vessel. The method includes receiving, by a computing device from a sensor coupled to the vessel, data indicative of one or more conditions associated with the vessel; determining, by the computing device, whether the one or more conditions satisfy at least one predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the one or more conditions satisfy the at least one predetermined criterion, identifying, by the computing device, an individual associated with the detected condition(s); and transmitting, by the computing device, information related to the identified individual over a communication network.

Most of it is occupied by a deep-dish amphitheater that is capable of seating close to a million avatars at once. Down at the bottom is a huge circular stage.

221.title: Computer-implemented systems and methods for detecting unauthorized access to a computing system
221.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and systems for detecting unauthorized access to a computing system. In one implementation, a method includes determining that an application associated with a user account has been executed by another user account; identifying at least one suspicious event in connection with the execution of the application by the other user account; analyzing activity data associated with the first user account over a period of time including the execution of the application by the other user account; classifying the first user account as authorized or unauthorized based on the analysis of the activity data; and responsive to classifying the first user account as unauthorized, generating an alert indicating that the first user account is suspected of being compromised.

222.content: The mystery light goes off. The others are still blinded, but Y.T. sees into the night with her Knight Visions, sees all the way into near infrared, and she sees the source of it, a double-bladed stealth helicopter thirty feet above the neighbor's house. It is tastefully black and unadorned, not a news crew—though another helicopter, an old-fashioned audible one, brightly festooned with up-to-the-minute logos, is thumping and whacking its way across White Columns airspace at this very moment, goosing the plantations with its own spotlight, hoping to be the first to obtain this major scoop: a pizza was delivered late tonight, film at eleven. Later, our personality journalist speculates on where Uncle Enzo will stay when he makes his compulsory trip to our Standard Metropolitan Statistical Area. But the black chopper is running dark, would be nearly invisible if not for the infrared trail coming out of its twin turbojets. It is a Mafia chopper, and all they wanted to do was to record the event on videotape so that Mr. Pudgely would not have a leg to hop around on in court, should he decide to take his case down to Judge Bob's Judicial System and argue for a free pizza. One more thing. There's a lot of shit in the air tonight, a few megatons of topsoil blowing down from Fresno, and so when the laser beam comes on it is startlingly visible, a tiny geometric line, a million blazing red grains strung on a fiber-optic thread, snapping into life instantly between the chopper and Y.T.'s chest. It appears to widen into a narrow fan, an acute triangle of red light whose base encompasses all of Y.T.'s torso.
222.title: Night vision goggles
222.abstract: According to an aspect of the present disclosure, night vision goggles are provided. The night vision goggles may include a head-mounted display configured to be positioned in front of a user's eyes and at least one image capture device configured to capture images around the user while the user is wearing the head-mounted display. The night vision goggles may further include processing circuitry configured to receive data from the at least one image capture device indicative of ambient light detected by the at least one image capture device during operation of the night vision goggles. The processing circuitry may also be configured to determine that the amount of ambient light detected by the at least one image capture device exceeds a predetermined brightness threshold. 224.content: And Hiro's strapped onto Reason. Flipping into gargoyle mode, he can clearly make out a sparse picket line of hemispherical domes running along the edge of the Enterprise's flight deck. The radar gear thoughtfully identifies these, onscreen, as the radar antennas of Phalanx antimissile guns. Underneath each dome, a multibarreled gun protrudes. He slows to a near stop and waves the barrel of Reason back and forth for a while until a cross hairs whips across his field of vision. That's the aiming point. He gets it settled down in the middle, right on one of those Phalanx guns, and jerks the trigger for half a second.
224.title: Method and apparatus for defeating phalanx missile defense systems
224.abstract: A method of defeating a phalanx missile defense system includes transmitting, from an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) to the phalanx missile defense system, a first radio frequency (RF) pulse. The UAV is positioned within a range of the phalanx missile defense system such that the phalanx missile defense system detects the first RF pulse. In response to detection of the first RF pulse by the phalanx missile defense system, the UAV transmits one or more second RF pulses toward the phalanx missile defense system. Each of the one or more second RF pulses are configured to overload at least one component of the phalanx missile defense system. 225.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer-readable storage medium, for managing digital assets. In some implementations, a method includes identifying a plurality of digital assets associated with a user, wherein
225.abstract: a first digital asset in the plurality of digital assets is an original version of a second digital asset in the plurality of digital assets; determining that at least one of the plurality of digital assets has not been accessed by the user within a predetermined period of time; responsive to determining that at least one of the plurality of digital assets has not been accessed by the user within the predetermined period of time, causing presentation of information indicative of the at least one of the plurality of digital assets having not been accessed by the user within the predetermined period of time.

226.content: Then she feels them spreading apart—way, way apart—Raven's thighs must be bigger around than his waist. He has lifted one leg up into her crotch and put the foot up on a chair so she's straddling his thigh, and with his arms he's holding her body up against him, squeezing and relaxing, squeezing and relaxing, so that she's helplessly rocking back and forth, all her weight on her crotch. Some huge muscle, the upmost part of his quadricep, angles up where it attaches to the bone in his pelvis, and as he rocks her in closer and tighter she ends up straddling that, shoved against it so tight that she can feel the seams in the crotch of her coverall, feel the coins in the key pocket of Raven's black jeans. When he slides his hands downward, still pressing her inward, and squeezes her butt in both hands, so big it must be like squeezing an apricot, fingers so long they wrap around and push up into her crack and she rocks forward to get away from it but there's nowhere to go except into his body, her face breaking away from the kiss and sliding against the perspiration of his broad, smooth, whiskerless neck.
226.title: Sexual intercourse between a man and a woman having a height difference of at least 12 inches
226.abstract: Provided is a sexual intercourse method in which a man has sexual intercourse with a woman who has a height difference of at least 12 inches from the man. According to one aspect of the present invention, there is provided a sexual intercourse method comprising the steps of: (a) inserting an erect penis into a vagina; (b) thrusting the erect penis into the vagina so that the base of the erect penis comes into contact with the pubic bone of the woman; and (c) moving the erect penis back and forth inside the vagina while maintaining the above-described state such that the tip of the erect penis touches the upper wall of the vagina.

227.content: Came in its doors unable to write an English sentence, from Abkhazia, Rwanda, Guanajuato, South Jersey, and came out knowing more about pizza than a Bedouin knows about sand. And they had studied this problem. Graphed the frequency of doorway delivery-time disputes. Wired the early Deliverators to record, then analyze, the debating tactics, the voice-stress histograms, the distinctive grammatical structures employed by white middle-class Type A Burbclave occupants who against all logic had decided that this was the place to take their personal Custerian stand against all that was stale and deadening in their lives: they were going to lie, or delude themselves, about the time of their phone call and get themselves a free pizza; no, they deserved a free pizza along with their life, liberty, and pursuit of whatever, it was fucking inalienable. Sent psychologists out to these people's houses, gave them a free TV set to submit to an anonymous interview, hooked them to polygraphs, studied their brain waves as they showed them choppy, inexplicable movies of porn queens and late-night car crashes and Sammy Davis, Jr., put them in sweet-smelling, mauve-walled rooms and asked them questions about Ethics so perplexing that even a Jesuit couldn't respond without committing a venial sin. The analysts at CosaNostra Pizza University concluded that it was just human nature and you couldn't fix it, and so they went for a quick cheap technical fix: smart boxes. The pizza box is a plastic carapace now, corrugated for stiffness, a little LED readout glowing on the side, telling the Deliverator how many trade imbalance-producing minutes have ticked away since the fateful phone call. There are chips and stuff in there. The pizzas rest, a short stack of them, in slots behind the Deliverator's head. Each pizza glides into a slot like a circuit board into a computer, clicks into place as the smart box interfaces with the onboard system of the Deliverator's car. The address of the caller has already been inferred from his phone number and poured into the smart box's built-in RAM. From there it is communicated to the car, which computes and projects the optimal route on a heads-up display, a glowing colored map traced out against the windshield so that the Deliverator does not even have to glance down. If the thirty-minute deadline expires, news of the disaster is flashed to CosaNostra Pizza Headquarters and relayed from there to Uncle Enzo himself—the Sicilian Colonel Sanders, the Andy Griffith of Bensonhurst, the straight razor-swinging figment of many a Deliverator's nightmares, the Capo and prime figurehead of CosaNostra Pizza, Incorporated—who will be on the phone to the customer within five minutes, apologizing profusely. The next day, Uncle Enzo will land on the customer's yard in a jet helicopter and apologize some more and give him a free trip to Italy—all he has to do is sign a bunch of releases that make him a public figure and spokesperson for CosaNostra Pizza and basically end his private life as he knows it.
227.title: Method and apparatus for delivering pizza
227.abstract: A method of delivering a pizza includes receiving an order to deliver a pizza from a customer, wherein the pizza comprises one or more ingredients. The method further includes determining a delivery time associated with the pizza in accordance with at least one of (i) a cooking time required to cook the one or more ingredients included in the pizza, (ii) a baking time required to bake the pizza, and (iii) a cooling time required to allow the pizza to cool after it is removed from an oven. The method also includes transmitting instructions to prepare the pizza according to the determined delivery time such that the pizza is delivered to the customer before the delivery time elapses.

228.content: The crown of thorns closes over her head, she feels the pricks of the electrodes through her scalp, senses the cool air flowing down over her shoulders from the superconducting quantum-interference devices that serve as radar into her brain. Somewhere on the other side of the wall, she knows, half a dozen personnel techs are sitting in a control room, looking at a big-screen blow-up of her pupils. Then she feels a burning prick in her forearm and knows she's been injected with something. Which means it's not a normal polygraph exam. Today she's in for something special. The burning spreads throughout her body, her heart thumps, eyes water. She's been shot up with caffeine to make her hyper, make her talkative.
228.title: Method and apparatus for detecting deception
228.abstract: A method of detecting deception includes receiving, by an electronic device from a user, one or more audio signals corresponding to the user's speech. The method also includes generating, by the electronic device using at least one deep neural network (DNN), a first representation of the one or more audio signals. The method further includes determining, by the electronic device according to the first representation, whether the user is being deceptive in providing the one or more audio signals. In response to determining that the user is being deceptive in providing the one or more audio signals, the method additionally includes presenting, by the electronic device, a notification indicating that the user is being deceptive in providing the one or more audio signals. Correspondingly, there is provided a computer-readable storage medium storing one or more instructions executable by one or more processors of an electronic device to cause the electronic device to perform the above-described method.

229.content: This is all a part of the moving illustration drawn by his computer according to specifications coming down the fiber-optic cable. The people are pieces of software called avatars. They are the audiovisual bodies that people use to communicate with each other in the Metaverse. Hiro's avatar is now on the Street, too, and if the couples coming off the monorail look over in his direction, they can see him, just as he's seeing them. They could strike up a conversation: Hiro in the U-Stor-It in L.A. and the four teenagers probably on a couch in a suburb of Chicago, each with their own laptop.
229.title: Systems and methods for facilitating communication between users of a virtual reality environment
229.abstract: Implementations set forth herein relate to systems and methods for facilitating communication between users of a virtual reality (VR) environment. In one implementation, a VR system includes a display device configured to generate an immersive VR environment in which a plurality of avatars can interact with each other within the VR environment. The VR system also includes at least one processor coupled to memory. The at least one processor is configured to execute instructions stored in the memory to cause the at least one processor to perform operations including determining that two or more of the avatars are positioned proximate to each other within the VR environment, identifying first and second avatars among the plurality of avatars who are positioned proximate to each other within the VR environment, and presenting information via the display device indicating that the first and second avatars are positioned proximate to each other within the VR environment.

The numbers have vibrated themselves into a cloud of gritty red light as the radar speed sensor tries to lock onto something.
230.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an object in a field of view of a wheelchair user
230.abstract: A method is provided for detecting an object in a field of view of a wheelchair user. The method includes receiving, by a processor, image data from at least one camera associated with the wheelchair user; processing, by the processor, the received image data to generate processed image data; determining, by the processor, whether the processed image data indicates that there is an object in the field of view of the wheelchair user; and upon determining that the processed image data indicates that there is an object in the field of view of the wheelchair user, controlling, by the processor, movement of the wheelchair relative to the object such that the wheelchair does not collide with the object. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

231.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure relate to systems and methods for tracking a user's gaze within an augmented reality environment. 232.content: The perimeter security is that good. Jason notices that all the guards at this checkpoint are standing a little straighter, adjusting their ties, shooting their cuffs. Jason wants to climb out of his bullet-pocked Oldsmobile to show proper respect to whoever this guy is, but he can't get the door open because a big guard is standing right there, using the roof as a mirror. All too quickly, he's there. “Is this him?” he says to a guard. The guard looks at Jason for a couple of seconds, as though he can't quite believe it, then looks at the important man in the black suit and nods. The man in the black suit nods back, tugs on his cuffs a little bit, squints around him for a few moments, looking at the snipers up on the roofs, looking everywhere but at Jason. Then he steps forward one pace.
232.title: Method and apparatus for securing a perimeter
232.abstract: A method of securing a perimeter is disclosed. The method comprises detecting, by one or more sensors, an intrusion into the perimeter; in response to detecting the intrusion, activating at least one light emitting diode (LED) associated with the perimeter such that the LED(s) are operable to illuminate within a predetermined area around the perimeter; determining whether the activation of the LED(s) has resulted in detection of the intrusion outside the predetermined area using the one or more sensors; responsive to it being determined that the activation of the LED(s) has not resulted in detection of the intrusion outside the predetermined area, deactivating the LED(s); and responsive to it being determined that the activation of the LED(s) has resulted in detection of the intrusion outside the predetermined area, transmitting information indicative of the

People say that over there to the left, in Pacific Palisades, is a big building above the ocean where the Central Intelligence Corporation has its West Coast headquarters. Soon—like maybe tomorrow—she'll go up there, find that building, maybe just cruise past it and wave.
233.title: Fedland barrier
233.abstract: Structures and methods for forming an integrated circuit (IC) die are provided. The method includes providing a substrate, wherein the substrate has a first surface and a second surface opposite to the first surface; depositing a semiconductor material layer over the substrate such that the semiconductor material layer is disposed between the first surface and the second surface of the substrate; patterning the semiconductor material layer to form a plurality of trenches extending through the semiconductor material layer from the first surface to the second surface of the substrate; filling each of the plurality of trenches with one or more electrically conductive materials; and removing portions of the semiconductor material layer not covered by the one or more electrically conductive materials.

234.title: Methods and apparatus for transporting containers

235.title: Method and apparatus for facilitating employment
235.abstract: A method of facilitating employment includes receiving, by a computing device, an indication that a user is interested in applying for a job. The method also includes transmitting, by the computing device, one or more questions to be answered by the user. The method further includes receiving, by the computing device, answers to the one or more questions from the user. The method additionally includes determining, by the computing device, at least one characteristic of the user based on the answers to the one or more questions received from the user. The method further includes generating, by the computing device, a profile comprising the at least one characteristic of the user. The method still further includes transmitting, by the computing device, the profile to an employer associated with the job. Numerous other aspects are contemplated.

236.title: Method and apparatus for transporting an elevator in a wellbore
236.abstract: A method of transporting an elevator downhole includes lowering the elevator into a wellbore, wherein the elevator is configured to move up and down within the wellbore. The method also includes actuating at least one hydraulic cylinder coupled to the elevator such that the elevator moves up or down within the wellbore.

237.content: From a distance, it looks like a simple vial, but stepping up to look at it more closely Hiro can see at least half a dozen tiny individual compartments inside the thing, all connected to each other by capillary tubes. It has a red plastic cap on one end of it. The cap has a black rectangular window, and as Squeaky rotates it, Hiro can see the dark red glint of an inactive LED display inside, like looking at the display on a turned-off calculator. Underneath this is a small perforation. It isn't just a simple drilled hole. It is wide at the surface, rapidly narrowing to a nearly invisible pinpoint opening, like the bell of a trumpet. The compartments inside the vial are all partially filled with liquids. Some of them are transparent and some are blackish brown.
237.title: Microfluidic device and method of manufacturing microfluidic device
237.abstract: A microfluidic device includes a substrate, a channel formed in the substrate, an electrode disposed within the channel, wherein the electrode is electrically insulated from the substrate by at least one dielectric layer interposed between the electrode and the substrate. The microfluidic device further includes a plurality of protrusions extending into the channel to define a plurality of reservoirs separated by the plurality of protrusions such that each of the plurality of reservoirs is fluidly coupled to the channel but decoupled from another of the plurality of reservoirs via the plurality of protrusions.

238.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a person based on facial features
238.abstract: A method of identifying a person is provided. The method includes obtaining, by at least one processor, an input image comprising a plurality of pixels; extracting, by the at least one processor, a set of feature points from the input image; determining, by the at least one processor, a first distance between each pair of feature points in the set of feature points; calculating, by the at least one processor, a second distance between each pair of feature points in the set of feature points as a function of the first distance; selecting, by the at least one processor, a subset of feature points that satisfy a predetermined condition with respect to the second distance; classifying, by the at least one processor, the subset of feature points into clusters using a hierarchical agglomerative clustering (HAC) algorithm; and identifying, by the at least one processor, a face region within the input image corresponding to the subset of feature points

239.content: She makes a low-slung approach. Her poon's orbital plane is nearly vertical, it almost grinds on the twinkly suburban macadam on the forward limb of each orbit. When she pounds the release button, it takes off from an altitude of about one centimeter, angling slightly upward, across the street, under the floor of the bimbo box, and sucks steel. It's a solid hit, as solid as you can get on this nebula of air, upholstery, paint, and marketing known as the family minivan. The reaction is instantaneous, quick-witted by Burb standards. This person wants Y.T. gone. The van takes off like a hormone-pumped bull who has just been nailed in the ass by the barbed probe of a picador. It's not Mom at the wheel. It's young Studley, the teenaged boy, who like every other boy in this Burbclave has been taking intravenous shots of horse testosterone every afternoon in the high school locker room since he was fourteen years old. Now he's bulky, stupid, thoroughly predictable. He steers erratically, artificially pumped muscles not fully under his control. The molded, leather-grained, maroon-colored steering wheel smells like his mother's hand lotion; this drives him into a rage. The bimbo box surges and slows, surges and slows, because he is pumping the gas pedal, because holding it to the floor doesn't seem to have any effect. He wants this car to be like his muscles: more power than he knows what to do with. Instead, it hampers him. As a compromise, he hits the button that says POWER. Another button that says ECONOMY pops out and goes dead, reminding him, like an educational demonstration, that the two are mutually exclusive. The van's tiny engine downshifts, which makes it feel more powerful. He holds his foot steady on the gas and, making the run down Cottage Heights Road, the minivan's speed approaches one hundred kilometers. Approaching the terminus of Cottage Heights Road, where it tees into Bellewoode Valley Road, he espies a fire hydrant. TMAWH fire hydrants are numerous, for safety, and highly designed, for property values, not the squat iron things imprinted with the name of some godforsaken Industrial Revolution foundry and furry from a hundred variously flaked layers of cheap city paint. They are brass, robot-polished every Thursday morning, dignified pipes rising straight up from the perfect, chemically induced turf of the Burbclave lawns, flaring out to present potential firefighters with a menu of three possible hose connections. They were designed on a computer screen by the same aesthetes who designed the Dyna-Victorian houses and the tasteful mailboxes and the immense marble street signs that sit at each intersection like headstones. Designed on a computer screen, but with an eye toward the elegance of things past and forgotten about. Fire hydrants that tasteful people are proud to have on their front lawns. Fire hydrants that the real estate people don't feel the need to airbrush out of pictures.
239.title: Method and apparatus for removing a vehicle from a parking space
239.abstract: A method of removing a vehicle from a parking space includes detecting that the vehicle is to be removed from the parking space. The method also includes determining, in response to detecting that the vehicle is to be removed from the parking space, an amount of energy required to move the vehicle out of the parking space. The method further includes transmitting data indicative of the amount of energy required to move the vehicle out of the parking space.

240.title: Systems and methods for dispatching courier services
240.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include computer-implemented methods, computer program products, and computing systems that may be configured to perform one or more operations. In an implementation, the operation may include receiving information associated with a pickup request from a user device via a graphical user interface (GUI). The operation may also include determining whether at least one service provider is available to fulfill the pickup request within a predetermined amount of time. Responsive to determining that the at least one service provider is available to fulfill the pickup request within the predetermined amount of time, the operation may include transmitting instructions to the at least one service provider directing the at least one service provider to complete the pickup request in accordance with the predetermined amount of time. Numerous other aspects are contemplated.

241.content: Juanita with an antenna rising out of the base of her skull. She kneels down beside him, bends down, cups one hand around his ear, and whispers. The hot air tickles his. ear, he tries to move away from it but can't. She's whispering another long string of syllables.
241.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with an animal
241.abstract: A method of communicating with an animal, the method comprising: (a) obtaining at least one audio signal; (b) processing the at least one audio signal to produce at least one processed audio signal; and (c) transmitting the at least one processed audio signal to the animal. An apparatus for communicating with an animal is also disclosed.

242.content: Fisheye, if any other floating object comes within a hundred feet of us, sink it. “If you see Raft people with antennas coming out of their heads, try to kill them first, because they can talk to each other.” “Antennas coming out of their heads?” Hiro says. “Yeah. Raft gargoyle types,” Eliot says. “Who are they?”
242.title: Systems and methods for detecting and mitigating threats in a virtual reality environment
242.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting and mitigating threats in a virtual reality environment. In one implementation, a method includes receiving sensor data from at least one sensor associated with a user wearing a head-mounted display (HMD), wherein the sensor data is indicative of an object being held by the user; analyzing the sensor data to determine whether the object is a threat item; responsive to determining that the object is a threat item, transmitting a signal to the HMD indicating that the object is a threat item; and directing the user's gaze away from the object when the object is determined to be a threat item. Various other implementations are also contemplated.

243.content: “The problem with you hackers is you never stop working.” “That's what a hacker is,” Hiro says.
243.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
243.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to a computing device is disclosed. The method includes determining that the computing device has been inactive for a predetermined amount of time; while the computing device is determined to be inactive, obtaining sensor data from one or more sensors associated with the computing device; analyzing the sensor data to determine whether an anomalous event occurred during the predetermined amount of time; responsive to determining that an anomalous event did not occur during the predetermined amount of time, transmitting a notification indicating that the computing device remains secure; and responsive to determining that an anomalous event occurred during the predetermined amount of time, preventing further use of the computing device. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

244.content: The big Aleut guy hauls up a chunk of rope and drapes it under one arm and over one leg in a quick motion. Then he throws one arm around Y.T.'s waist, gathering her in the crook of his arm, leans back, and falls off the ship.
244.title: Method and apparatus for deploying a buoy from a vessel
244.abstract: A method of deploying a buoy from a vessel includes receiving an indication that the buoy is to be deployed. The method also includes lowering the buoy into water by releasing the buoy from the vessel, wherein the buoy comprises one or more air bladders configured to inflate with pressurized gas in order to provide buoyancy to the buoy. The method further includes controlling deployment of the one or more air bladders such that at least some of the one or more air bladders do not inflate until after the buoy has reached a predetermined depth below the surface of the water.

245.content: Most of them are accessed via a communal loading dock that leads to a maze of wide corrugated-steel hallways and freight elevators. These are slum housing, 5-by-10s and 10-by-10s where Yanoama tribespersons cook beans and parboil fistfuls of coca leaves over heaps of burning lottery tickets. It is whispered that in the old days, when the U-Stor-It was actually used for its intended purpose (namely, providing cheap extra storage space to Californians with too many material goods), certain entrepreneurs came to the front office, rented out 10-by-10s using fake IDs, filled them up with steel drums full of toxic chemical waste, and then abandoned them, leaving the problem for the U-Stor-It Corporation to handle. According to these rumors, U-Stor-It just padlocked those units and wrote them off. Now, the immigrants claim, certain units remain haunted by this chemical specter. It is a story they tell their children, to keep them from trying to break into padlocked units.
245.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to a storage unit
245.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized access to a storage unit includes receiving, by a computing device from one or more sensors coupled to the storage unit, sensor data indicative of at least one physical characteristic of the storage unit. The method also includes determining, by the computing device using machine-learning techniques applied to the received sensor data, whether there has been an unauthorized access to the storage unit during a predetermined time period.

246.content: Throwbacks to the days of prerational religion. Throwbacks to Sumer.
246.title: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on a computer storage medium, for implementing a sumerian-inspired fantasy role-playing game. In some implementations, a method includes presenting, to a user,
246.abstract: a first screen of a Sumerian-inspired fantasy role-playing game (SIFRPG), the first screen comprising an avatar customization interface; receiving, from the user, one or more selections via the avatar customization interface; generating, in response to the one or more selections, a second screen of the SIFRPG, the second screen depicting at least a portion of the avatar according to the one or more selections; and causing presentation of the second screen of the SIFRPG as the first screen of the SIFRPG.

247.content: It is her reconstruction of the psychological environment inside of that bimbo box. She sees the hydrant coming a mile away, sees Studley reaching down to rest one hand on the parking brake. It is all so obvious. She feels sorry for Studley and his ilk. She reels out, gives herself lots of slack. He whips the wheel, jerks the brake. The minivan goes sideways, overshooting its mark, and doesn't quite snap her around the way he wanted; she has to help it. As its ass is rotating around, she reels in hard, converting that gift of angular momentum into forward velocity, and ends up shooting right past the van going well over a mile a minute.
247.title: Apparatuses, systems, and methods for use with a bimbo box are disclosed herein. The bimbo box may include a plurality of compartments configured to store a plurality of bimbo dolls
247.abstract: A method includes receiving an input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the GUI is displayed on a display device; in response to receipt of the input by the computing system, determining one or more characteristics associated with at least one of the plurality of bimbo dolls stored in each of the plurality of compartments included in the bimbo box; comparing the one or more characteristics associated with the at least one of the plurality of bimbo dolls stored in each of the plurality of compartments included in the bimbo box; and outputting information indicative of the comparison between the one or more characteristics associated with the at least one of the plurality of bimbo dolls stored in each of the plurality of compartments included in the bimbo box

248.content: Hiro sees another small craft bobbing on the water, about halfway between the Russians and the speedboat that was towing them. It's not obvious, because it's tiny, close to the water, done up in dull natural colors.
248.title: Method and apparatus for deploying an unmanned underwater vehicle (UUV)
248.abstract: A method of operating an unmanned underwater vehicle (UUV) is disclosed. The method comprises detecting, by the UUV, one or more objects within a predetermined distance from the UUV; determining whether at least one of the detected objects corresponds to a hazardous object; in response to determining that at least one of the detected objects corresponds to a hazardous object, adjusting a trajectory of the UUV such that the UUV avoids contact with the hazardous object; and controlling movement of the UUV according to the adjusted trajectory.

249.content: Each neighborhood is afraid that the neighboring 'hoods are going to gang up on them, cut them loose, leave them to starve in the middle of the Pacific. So they are constantly finding new ways to tie themselves into each other, running cables over, under, and around their neighbors, tying into more far-flung 'hoods, or preferably into one of the Core ships. The neighborhood guards are armed, needless to say. Looks like the weapon of choice is a small Chinese knock-off of the AK-47. Its metal frame jumps out pretty clearly on radar.
249.title: Method and apparatus for securing a spacecraft to another spacecraft
249.abstract: A method of securing a first spacecraft to a second spacecraft includes the steps of (a) moving the first spacecraft relative to the second spacecraft such that at least a portion of the first spacecraft is disposed within an envelope defined by the second spacecraft; (b) deploying one or more tethers between the first spacecraft and the second spacecraft in response to movement of the first spacecraft relative to the second spacecraft, wherein the one or more tethers are configured to secure the first spacecraft to the second spacecraft; and (c) preventing further movement of the first spacecraft relative to the second spacecraft after deployment of the one or more tethers. An apparatus for securing a first spacecraft to a second spacecraft may also be provided.

250.content: He could keep turning it off and on every time it does this, but this is awkward in the heat of battle, and not the type of solution that hackers admire. It would be much more sensible just to debug it. Which he could do by hand, if he had time. But there may be a better way of going about it. It's possible that, by now, Ng Security Industries has fixed the bug—come out with a new version of the software.
250.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized access to an electronic device
250.abstract: A method of detecting unauthorized access to an electronic device includes receiving, by a processor from a sensor coupled to the electronic device, data indicative of one or more physical characteristics of the electronic device. The method also includes determining, by the processor, whether the received data is within a predetermined range of expected values associated with the one or more physical characteristics of the electronic device. In response to determining that the received data is not within the predetermined range of expected values, the method further includes transmitting, by the processor, at least one notification indicating that there has been unauthorized access to the electronic device; and in response to determining that the received data is within the predetermined range of expected values, refraining from transmitting the at least one notification. Corresponding apparatus, systems, devices and articles of manufacture are also disclosed.

251.content: And hold on a second.” Hiro walks over to the base of the control tower. There's a door there that gives him access to a stairwell. He climbs up to the control room, a strange mixture of Iron Age and high-tech. Juanita's waiting there, surrounded by peacefully slumbering wireheads. She taps a microphone that is projecting from a communications panel at the end of a flexible gooseneck—the same mike that the en was speaking into.
251.title: Method and apparatus for controlling a subject's state of consciousness
251.abstract: A method, an apparatus, and at least one computer program product are disclosed for controlling a subject's state of consciousness. The method comprises the steps of obtaining physiological data associated with the subject; determining whether the obtained physiological data satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the obtained physiological data satisfies the predetermined criterion, delivering electrical stimulation pulses via electrodes attached to the subject so as to control the subject's state of consciousness; and repeating the step of determining whether the obtained physiological data satisfies the predetermined criterion until it is determined that the obtained physiological data does not satisfy the predetermined criterion.

252.content: The head Crip turns away and gestures back toward his black BMW. The rear door of the BMW opens up and a man gets out, a younger, smaller black man in round wire-rims, wearing jeans and big white athletic shoes and typical studentish gear. The student walks slowly toward Raven, pulling something from his pocket. It's a hand-held device, but much too bulky to be a calculator. It's got a keypad on the top and a sort of window on one end, which the student keeps aiming toward Raven. There's an LED read-out above the keypad and a red flashing light underneath that. The student is wearing a pair of headphones that are jacked into a socket on the butt of the device. For starters, the student aims the window at the ground, then at the sky, then at Raven, keeping his eye on the flashing red light and the LED readout. It has the feel of some kind of religious rite, accepting digital input from the sky spirit and then the ground spirit and then from the black biker angel. Then he begins to walk slowly toward Raven, one step at a time. Hiro can see the red light flashing intermittently, not following any particular pattern or rhythm. The student gets to within a yard of Raven and then orbits him a couple of times, always keeping the device aimed inward. When he's finished, he steps back briskly, turns, and aims it toward the motorcycle. When the device is aimed at the motorcycle, the red light flashes much more quickly. The student walks up to the head Crip, pulling off his headphones, and has a short conversation with him. The Crip listens to the student but keeps his eyes fixed on Raven, nods his head a few times, finally pats the student on his shoulder and sends him back to the BMW. It was a Geiger counter. Raven strolls up to the big Crip.
252.title: Method and apparatus for detecting and/or preventing unauthorized access to a computing device
252.abstract: A method of detecting and/or preventing unauthorized access to a computing device is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) determining, by at least one sensor associated with the computing device, an identity of a user; (b) comparing the identity of the user determined in step (a) against stored information relating to users authorized to use the computing device; and (c) if the identity of the user determined in step (a) does not match any of the stored information relating to users authorized to use the computing device, denying access to the computing device by the user whose identity was determined in step (a).

253.content: Raven pumped full of speed: just what the world needs right now. They drag her across the deck of the next ship. From there they take a stairway thingy up to the next ship after that, which is very big. She thinks it's an oil tanker. She can look across its broad deck, through a tangle of pipes, rust seeping through white paint, and see the Enterprise on the other side. That's where they're going. There's no direct connection. A crane on the deck of the Enterprise has swung itself over to dangle a small wire cage over the tanker, just a few feet off the deck; it bobs up and down and glides back and forth over a fairly large area as the two ships rock in different ways and it swings like a pendulum at the end of its cable. It has a door on one side, which is hanging open. They sort of toss her into it head first, keeping her arms pinned to her sides so she can't push it away from her, and then they spend a few seconds folding her legs in behind her.
253.title: Method and apparatus for transferring a subject from a first vessel to a second vessel
253.abstract: A method of transferring a subject from a first vessel to a second vessel includes the steps of (a) providing an interstitial space between the inner wall of the first vessel and the outer wall of the second vessel; (b) filling the interstitial space with a fluid that is substantially incompressible, wherein the fluid comprises at least one gaseous substance selected from the group consisting of nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, helium, xenon, argon, krypton, and mixtures thereof; (c) introducing the subject into the interstitial space such that the subject is immersed in the fluid within the interstitial space; and (d) moving the second vessel relative to the first vessel so as to reduce the volume of the interstitial space while maintaining the subject immersed in the fluid.

254.content: Y.T. picks up a loose poon handle that no one has bothered to reel in yet. She hits the button that turns off the electromagnet and its head drops off the chopper's armor. She reels it in until about four feet of slack is there between the reel and the head.
254.title: Method and apparatus for retrieving an object from a body of water
254.abstract: A method is disclosed for retrieving an object from a body of water. The method comprises the steps of: (a) deploying at least one buoy in the body of water; (b) locating the object within the body of water by transmitting acoustic pulses into the body of water, wherein the acoustic pulses are reflected off the object to form echoes; (c) determining a location of the object with respect to the at least one buoy using the echoes; and (d) retrieving the object from the body of water towards the at least one buoy according to the determined location of the object relative to the at least one buoy. An apparatus for retrieving an object from a body of water is also disclosed.

255.content: He was keeping it under his clothes, the way Y.T. keeps Uncle Enzo's dog tags. He has pulled it out now and shoved it into a slot inside the aluminum case. It appears to be a laminated ID card with a bar code on it. Now he pulls the card out and lets it dangle down his front.
255.title: Method and apparatus for authenticating an identity of a user
255.abstract: A method is provided for authenticating an identity of a user. The method comprises the steps of: (a) transmitting, from a first device to a second device via a communication network, at least one identifier associated with the first device; (b) receiving, by the second device in response to step (a), at least one confirmation message relating to the at least one identifier that was transmitted in step (a); (c) determining whether the at least one confirmation message received in step (b) corresponds to the at least one identifier transmitted in step (a); and (d) if it is determined in step (c) that the at least one confirmation message received in step (b) corresponds to the at least one identifier transmitted in step (a), authenticating the identity of the user as being associated with the first device. A corresponding system and computer program product are also provided.

256.content: A bundle of lasers sweeps across the embankment, clearly visible in the fine dust being drawn out of it by the wind. “This guy—this bug—was using lasers. As soon as he came up here—” “They betrayed his position,” Squeaky says.
256.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an object
256.abstract: A method of detecting an object, the method comprising: obtaining image data from at least one camera; processing the image data to determine whether there is an object within a predetermined field of view of the at least one camera; in response to determining that there is an object within the predetermined field of view of the at least one camera, controlling actuators associated with the at least one camera to move the at least one camera relative to the object so as to maintain the object within the predetermined field of view of the at least one camera.

257.content: “So Enki even provided them with their medium for conveying information—clay. They wrote on wet clay and then they dried it out—got rid of the water. If water got to it later, the information was destroyed. But if they baked it and drove out all the water, sterilized Enki's semen with heat, then the tablet lasted forever, immutable, like the words of the Torah.
257.title: Method and apparatus for preservation of genetic material
257.abstract: A method is provided for preserving genetic material.
