The method comprises the steps of (a) providing a container having at least one compartment, wherein each compartment has an opening; (b) introducing a first quantity of water into the container; (c) introducing a second quantity of water less than the first quantity of water into the container; (d) introducing a third quantity of water greater than the second quantity of water but less than the first quantity of water into the container; (e) introducing a fourth quantity of water greater than the third quantity of water but less than the first quantity of water into the container; (f) introducing a fifth quantity of water greater than the fourth quantity of water but less than the first quantity of water into the container; (g) introducing a sixth quantity of water greater than the fifth quantity of water but less than the first quantity of water into the container; (h) introducing

258.content: I don't know how my face conveyed that information, or what kind of internal wiring in my grandmother's mind enabled her to accomplish this incredible feat. To condense fact from the vapor of nuance.” Condense fact from the vapor of nuance. Hiro has never forgotten the sound of her speaking those words, the feeling that came over him as he realized for the first time how smart Juanita was.
258.title: Apparatus and method for determining a user's emotional state
258.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for determining a user's emotional state. In one embodiment, the present invention provides an apparatus comprising at least one processor coupled to a memory configured with instructions that when executed by the at least one processor cause the at least one processor to perform operations. The operations can include receiving audio data from a microphone of a computing device; processing the audio data to extract acoustic features therefrom; classifying the acoustic features as belonging to one of a plurality of predetermined emotional states; and outputting information indicative of the classification of the acoustic features into one of the plurality of predetermined emotional states.

259.content: Software comes out of factories, and hackers are, to a greater or lesser extent, assembly-line workers. Worse yet, they may become managers who never get to write any code themselves. The prospect of becoming an assembly-line worker gives Hiro some incentive to go out and find some really good intel tonight. He tries to get himself psyched up, tries to break out of the lethargy of the long-term underemployed. This intel thing can be a great racket, once you get yourself jacked into the grid.
259.title: Systems and methods for detecting unauthorized software on a computing device
259.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting unauthorized software on a computing device. In one implementation, an apparatus includes at least one processor configured to execute instructions that cause the apparatus to perform operations. The operations can include obtaining information associated with applications installed on a computing device; determining whether each application included in the obtained information is authorized or unauthorized according to predetermined criteria; and outputting data indicative of which applications are authorized and which applications are unauthorized. Various other implementations are also contemplated.

260.content: The sound and wind of Rife's chopper diminish into a distant puttering noise that takes a long time to go away completely. He feels a tingling behind his ear, anticipating the scalpel and the drill. These wireheads are operating under remote control from somewhere else. Ng seemed to think that they had an organized Raft defense system. Maybe there's a hacker-in-charge, an en, sitting in the Enterprise's control tower, moving these guys around like an air traffic controller.
260.title: Systems and methods for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device
260.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting unauthorized access to a computing device. In one implementation, a method includes determining that an input is received at a touch-sensitive display of the computing device; in response to determining that the input is received at the touch-sensitive display within a predetermined period of time, obtaining biometric information associated with a user of the computing device; comparing the biometric information obtained from the touch-sensitive display to previously stored biometric information associated with authorized users of the computing device; and in response to determining that the biometric information obtained from the touch-sensitive display differs from the previously stored biometric information by more than a threshold amount, generating an alert indicative of unauthorized access to the computing device.

261.content: While Y.T. climbs down out of the van with her skateboard, Ng makes new sounds with his mouth. She hears a gliding and clunking noise resonating through the frame of the van, machinery coming to life. Turning back to look, she sees that a steel cocoon on the roof of the van has opened up. There is a miniature helicopter underneath it, all folded up. Its rotor blades spread themselves apart, like a butterfly unfolding. Its name is painted on its side: WHIRLWIND REAPER.
261.title: Method and apparatus for transporting an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
261.abstract: A method of transporting an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) includes receiving, by a first UAV from a second UAV, a request to transport the second UAV. The method also includes transmitting, by the first UAV in response to receipt of the request, a confirmation that the first UAV is available to transport the second UAV. The method further includes receiving, by the first UAV from the second UAV, one or more GPS coordinates corresponding to a location at which the second UAV desires to be dropped off. The method additionally includes dropping off, by the first UAV after receiving the one or more GPS coordinates, the second UAV at the location indicated by the one or more GPS coordinates.

262.content: “It's not a good idea to declare war on a nuclear power.” “Huh?” “Christ,” Squeaky says, shaking his head, “if I had any idea how little you knew about this shit, I never would have let you into my car. I thought you were some kind of a serious CIC wet-operations guy.
262.title: Method and apparatus for disarming a nuclear missile
262.abstract: A method of disarming a nuclear missile includes receiving, by a computing device from an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), at least one image captured by the UAV; determining, by the computing device, that the at least one image depicts a plurality of components of the nuclear missile; identifying, by the computing device, each of the plurality of components in the at least one image; retrieving, by the computing device, data associated with each of the plurality of components identified in the at least one image; verifying, by the computing device, authenticity of the data associated with each of the plurality of components identified in the at least one image; and disarming, by the computing device, the nuclear missile based on the verified authenticity of the data associated with each of the plurality of components identified in the at least one image. Corresponding apparatus,

263.content: “All television going out to consumers throughout the world goes through me. Most of the information transmitted to and from the CIC database passes through my networks. The Metaverse—the entire Street—exists by virtue of a network that I own and control. “But that means, if you'll just follow my reasoning for a bit, that when I have a programmer working under me who is working with that information, he is wielding enormous power. Information is going into his brain. And it's staying there. It travels with him when he goes home at night.
263.title: Systems and methods for managing data
263.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing data. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an indication that a first set of data is to be stored in a storage device associated with a computing system. The method further includes storing the first set of data in the storage device. Additionally, the method includes generating a second set of data by encrypting at least a portion of the first set of data using a cryptographic key. Further, the method includes storing the second set of data in the storage device. Yet further, the method includes transmitting the second set of data from the storage device to a remote computing system. Numerous other aspects are also claimed and described.

264.content: That's why the damn place is so overdeveloped. Put in a sign or a building on the Street and the hundred million richest, hippest, best-connected people on earth will see it every day of their lives. It is a hundred meters wide, with a narrow monorail track running down the middle. The monorail is a free piece of public utility software that enables users to change their location on the Street rapidly and smoothly. A lot of people just ride back and forth on it, looking at the sights. When Hiro first saw this place, ten years ago, the monorail hadn't been written yet; he and his buddies had to write car and motorcycle software in order to get around. They would take their software out and race it in the black desert of the electronic night.
264.title: Apparatus and method for providing a street of dreams, the apparatus comprising: a plurality of light sources; a plurality of sensors; a plurality of actuators; and a controller configured to control the
264.abstract: (a) receive data from at least some of the plurality of sensors indicative of one or more objects in an environment external to the apparatus; (b) determine positions of the plurality of light sources using the received data; (c) provide instructions to the plurality of actuators such that the plurality of light sources are caused to illuminate according to the determined positions of the plurality of light sources; and (d) change the determined positions of the plurality of light sources responsive to receiving further data from at least some of the plurality of sensors.

265.content: Most of the room is taken up by electronics. Big electronics. “Going to just do some computer stuff, y'know,” he says, handing the briefcase over to a computer guy. Y.T. knows he's a computer guy because he has long hair in a ponytail and he's wearing jeans and he seems gentle.
265.title: Systems and methods for managing electronic documents
265.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing electronic documents. In one implementation, an apparatus includes processing circuitry configured to execute instructions stored in at least one non-transitory machine-readable storage medium. The execution of the instructions by the processing circuitry causes the processing circuitry to perform operations comprising receiving user input identifying a plurality of search terms associated with a first electronic document; determining that each of the plurality of search terms corresponds to a respective portion of text within the first electronic document; extracting the respective portions of text corresponding to the plurality of search terms from the first electronic document; converting the respective portions of text extracted from the first electronic document into structured data; and storing the structured data as part of a second electronic document.

266.content: Then she pulls a hypercard out of her pocket. “Here. Take this.” As Hiro pulls it from her hand, the hypercard changes from a jittery two-dimensional figment into a realistic, cream-colored, finely textured piece of stationery. Printed across its face in glossy black ink is a pair of words 9 The world freezes and grows dim for a second.
266.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for presenting an augmented reality interface to a user
266.abstract: A method of operating a head mounted device (HMD) is provided. The method includes determining that the HMD is being worn by a user; obtaining image data from one or more sensors associated with the HMD; processing the image data to identify at least one object in the image data; identifying whether the at least one object identified in the image data corresponds to a predetermined type of object; responsive to it being determined that the at least one object identified in the image data corresponds to the predetermined type of object, generating an augmented reality representation of the at least one object corresponding to the predetermined type of object; and displaying the augmented reality representation of the at least one object corresponding to the predetermined type of object overlaid onto the image data obtained from the one or more sensors associated with the HMD. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

267.content: Hiro looks up into the control tower and sees a couple of faces looking down at him. One of them—the en—is talking into a microphone. Eventually, they come to a big flat elevator that sinks down into the guts of the ship, out of view of the control tower. It comes to rest on one of the lower decks, apparently a hangar deck where they used to maintain airplanes. Hiro hears a woman's voice, speaking words gently but clearly: “me lu lu mu al nu um me en ki me en me lu lu mu me al nu um me al nu ume me me mu lu e al nu um me dug ga mu me mu lu e al nu um me . . .” It's three feet straight down to the deck, and he covers the distance in free fall, slamming down on his back, bumping his head.
267.title: Method and apparatus for communicating with an extraterrestrial
267.abstract: A method of communicating with an extraterrestrial is disclosed. The method includes transmitting, to the extraterrestrial, a plurality of pulses at a first frequency; receiving, from the extraterrestrial, a plurality of response pulses at a second frequency that is different than the first frequency; determining whether one or more of the response pulses are within a predetermined time period of each other; in response to determining that none of the response pulses are within the predetermined time period of each other, generating additional pulses at the first frequency; and transmitting the additional pulses to the extraterrestrial. An apparatus for communicating with an extraterrestrial is also disclosed.

268.content: By the time he gets behind the cover of another plane, his sense of hearing is being overwhelmed by the approach of a chopper. It is Rife's chopper, settling down on the tarmac a few dozen meters away from the jet. The thunder of the rotor blades and the blast of the wind seem to penetrate into Uncle Enzo's brain.
268.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and locating sound sources in a noisy environment
268.abstract: A system comprises an acoustic sensor configured to receive one or more sensed signals. A processing unit is coupled to the acoustic sensor, wherein the processing unit is configured to process the one or more sensed signals received by the acoustic sensor to generate at least one processed signal. The processing unit is further configured to determine a direction of arrival (DOA) from the at least one processed signal. An output device is coupled to the processing unit, wherein the output device is configured to provide information regarding the DOA determined by the processing unit.

269.content: “It's only got one control. Twist the throttle and it goes.” And then he points his boat out toward the open water and drills it. Dimly superimposed on Reality, he can see the black-and-white figure of Y.T. sitting in front of him on the motorcycle; she reaches out for the throttle and both of them jerk forward and slam into the wall of a skyscraper at Mach 1. He turns off his view of the Metaverse entirely, making the goggles totally transparent. Then he switches his system into full gargoyle mode: enhanced visible light with false-color infrared, plus millimeter-wave radar. His view of the world goes into grainy black and white, much brighter than it was before. Here and there, certain objects glow fuzzily in pink or red. This comes from the infrared, and it means that these things are warm or hot; people are pink, engines and fires are red. The millimeter-wave radar stuff is superimposed much more cleanly and crisply in neon green. Anything made of metal shows up. Hiro is now navigating down a grainy, charcoal-gray avenue of water lined with grainy, light gray pontoon bridges tied up to crisp neon-green barges and ships that glow reddishly from place to place, wherever they are generating heat.
269.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) using a virtual reality (VR) head-mounted display (HMD)
269.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) using a virtual reality (VR) head-mounted display (HMD). The method includes displaying, via the VR HMD, a three-dimensional (3D) environment in which the UAV is to be flown. The method further includes detecting at least one user input provided by a user wearing the VR HMD while viewing the 3D environment displayed via the VR HMD. The method additionally includes determining that the at least one user input corresponds to a command to fly the UAV within the 3D environment. In response to determining that the at least one user input corresponds to the command to fly the UAV within the 3D environment, the method also includes controlling flight of the UAV within the 3D environment according to the command.

270.content: The Kourier leans back—the Deliverator can't help watching in the rearview—leans back like a water skier, pushes off against his board, and swings around beside him, now traveling abreast with him up Heritage Boulevard and slap another sticker goes up, this one on the windshield! It says SMOOTH MOVE, EX-LAX The Deliverator has heard of these stickers.
270.title: Method and apparatus for delivering packages
270.abstract: A method of delivering a package to a recipient is disclosed. The method includes the steps of receiving, by a mobile device carried by a delivery person, an indication of a plurality of geo-locations associated with one or more stops along a route between a shipping location and a delivery location; determining whether any of the plurality of geo-locations are within a predetermined distance from each other; in response to determining that at least two of the plurality of geo-locations are not within the predetermined distance from each other, transmitting data representative of the plurality of geo-locations to a remote server; receiving instructions from the remote server directing the mobile device to stop at selected ones of the plurality of geo-locations; and stopping at the selected ones of the plurality of geo-locations according to the instructions received from the remote server

271.content: She hands Hiro a little white box and a pair of chopsticks. “Spicy chicken with black bean sauce, no MSG. You know how to use chopsticks?” Hiro shrugs off this insult. “I got a double order,” Y.T. continues, “cause I figure we got some good intel tonight.” “Are you aware of what happened here?”
271.title: Chinatown international
271.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems, methods, and computer-readable storage media for determining one or more geo-fences associated with a user device. The method includes obtaining location data from the user device; analyzing the location data to identify an area in which the user device is currently located; comparing the identified area to historical location data obtained from the user device over a predetermined period of time; identifying at least one geo-fence that encompasses both the identified area and the historical location data; and storing the at least one geo-fence as part of a set of geo-fences associated with the user device. In some implementations, the method further includes transmitting notifications to the user device when the user device enters or exits each geo-fence included in the set of geo-fences.

272.content: The security daemons have all turned around and are chasing him. They can figure out where he is—the computer tells them that much—but they can't do much to him. Like the bouncer daemons in The Black Sun, which Hiro helped write, they shove people around by applying basic rules of avatar physics.
272.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an avatar in a virtual environment
272.abstract: A method of controlling an avatar in a virtual environment is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: (a) determining, by at least one sensor associated with the avatar, data indicative of movement of the avatar; (b) generating, by a control unit operatively connected to the at least one sensor, a plurality of motion commands from the data determined in step (a); and (c) controlling, by the control unit, the avatar according to the plurality of motion commands generated in step (b), thereby causing the avatar to move within the virtual environment.

273.content: The numbers, flags, and other identifying goodies are harder to make out. The satellite has a hard time picking that stuff out. Hiro checks to see whether CIC has a stringer in Port Sherman. They have to, because the Raft is here, and CIC hopes to make a big business out of selling Raft intelligence to all the anxious waterfronters between Skagway and Tierra del Fuego. Indeed. There are a few people hanging out in this town, uploading the latest Port Sherman intel. And one of them is just a punter with a video camera who goes around shooting pictures of everything. Hiro reviews this stuff in fast-forward.
273.title: Method and apparatus for processing data received from a plurality of sensors of an autonomous or semi-autonomous unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
273.abstract: A method, apparatus, system, non-transitory computer readable medium, and computer process for processing data received from a plurality of sensors of an autonomous or semi-autonomous Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV).

274.content: “When you first turn on a computer, it is an inert collection of circuits that can't really do anything. To start up the machine, you have to infuse those circuits with a collection of rules that tell it how to function. How to be a computer. It sounds as though these me served as the operating system of the society, organizing an inert collection of people into a functioning system.”
274.title: Systems and methods for facilitating interaction between a plurality of users
274.abstract: Implementations include systems and methods for facilitating interactions between multiple users. In one implementation, the method includes receiving an indication that a first user is interested in interacting with a second user; determining whether the first user has previously interacted with the second user; if the first user has not previously interacted with the second user, transmitting a notification to the second user indicating that the first user is interested in interacting with the second user; upon receipt of the notification by the second user, enabling communication between the first user and the second user via a messaging application associated with the social networking system; and monitoring communications between the first user and the second user through the messaging application.

275.content: It's a low-flying CIC satellite, swinging north to south in a polar orbit. “Your information, sir,” the Librarian says. Hiro startles and glances up. Earth swings down and out of his field of view and there is the Librarian, standing in front of the desk, holding out a hypercard. Like any librarian in Reality, this daemon can move around without audible footfalls.
275.title: Satellite constellation with low-flying CIC satellites swinging north to south in a polar orbit
275.abstract: A satellite constellation includes at least one high inclination circular intersatellite communication (CIC) satellite and at least one Low Inclination Circular Intersatellite Communication (LICISC) satellite. The LICISC satellite has an orbital inclination of less than 70 degrees relative to the equator, wherein the center of mass of the LICISC satellite is closer to the Earth's equatorial plane than any other portion of the LICISC satellite. The satellite constellation further includes at least one medium inclination circular intersatellite communication (MICISC) satellite having an orbital inclination between 70 degrees and 120 degrees relative to the equator, wherein the center of mass of the MICISC satellite is closer to the Earth's equatorial plane than any other portion of the MICISC satellite. The satellite constellation further includes at least one

276.content: “You're a pretty decent piece of ware. Who wrote you, anyway?” “For the most part I write myself,” the Librarian says. “That is, I have the innate ability to learn from experience. But this ability was originally coded into me by my creator.”
276.title: Method and apparatus for creating a digital avatar in a virtual reality environment based on a user's real-world personality traits
276.abstract: A method of creating a digital avatar is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of (i) obtaining, from an electronic device associated with a user, biometric data indicative of one or more physiological characteristics of the user; (ii) determining at least one psychological characteristic of the user based on the obtained biometric data; (iii) receiving information relating to clothing being worn by the user when using the electronic device; (iv) generating a three-dimensional image of the user wearing the clothing received in step (iii); and (v) overlaying onto the three-dimensional image generated in step (iv) graphical elements representative of the at least one psychological characteristic determined in step (ii). A corresponding system and computer program product are also disclosed.

277.content: Other people—store clerks, burger flippers, software engineers, the whole vocabulary of meaningless jobs that make up Life in America—other people just rely on plain old competition. Better flip your burgers or debug your subroutines faster and better than your high school classmate two blocks down the strip is flipping or debugging, because we're in competition with those guys, and people notice these things. What a fucking rat race that is.
277.title: Systems and methods for facilitating competitions among users of a social network
277.abstract: Implementations relate to systems and methods for facilitating competitions among users of a social network. In one implementation, the method includes receiving an invitation from a first user to participate in a competition against a second user; determining that the first user is eligible to participate in the competition with the second user; transmitting instructions to the first user indicating that the first user is eligible to participate in the competition with the second user; receiving input from the first user accepting the invitation to participate in the competition with the second user; initiating the competition between the first user and the second user according to rules associated with the competition; and presenting results of the competition at a web page viewable by both the first user and the second user. Various other implementations are also described herein.

278.content: He is typing on the keyboard, punching away with two fingers, missing letters, doing it again. Then motors and servos inside the aluminum case whir and shudder. The Reverend Dale T. Thorpe has unsnapped one of the little vials from its place in the lid and inserted it into a socket next to the keyboard. It is slowly drawn down inside the machine. The vial pops back out again. The red plastic cap is emitting grainy red light. It has little LEDs built into it, and they are spelling out numbers, counting down seconds: 5,4,3,2,1 . . . The Reverend Dale T. Thorpe holds the vial up to his left nostril. When the LED counter gets down to zero, it hisses, like air coming out of a tire valve.
278.title: Method and apparatus for improving typing speed and/or accuracy
278.abstract: A method of training a user to improve typing speed and/or accuracy is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of receiving, at a computing device, a plurality of keystrokes inputted by a user; determining whether one or more of the plurality of keystrokes are erroneous in accordance with a predetermined criterion; responsive to determining that one or more of the plurality of keystrokes are erroneous, presenting an error indication associated with the erroneous key stroke(s), wherein the error indication provides feedback to the user as to which finger should be used to press the correct key corresponding to the erroneous key stroke(s); and repeating the step of determining whether one or more of the plurality of keystrokes are erroneous until it is determined that none of the plurality of keystrokes are

279.content: Squeaky hauls open the back door of the BMW and looks into the back seat. Hiro steps a little closer, gets a nasty whiff of cold smoke. It is the smell of burnt plastic. The aluminum briefcase that Raven earlier gave to T-Bone is sitting in the middle of the seat.
279.title: Method and apparatus for detecting an intruder in a vehicle
279.abstract: A method of detecting an intruder in a vehicle includes receiving, by one or more sensors disposed within the vehicle, sensor data indicative of conditions within the vehicle. The method also includes determining whether the sensor data satisfies at least one predetermined condition. In response to determining that the sensor data satisfies the at least one predetermined condition, the method further includes transmitting, via a communications link between the vehicle and a remote computing device, information associated with the sensor data satisfying the at least one predetermined condition.

280.content: She hands her stuff—the plank and the aluminum case—up to the man with the glass eye, then vaults up into the back of the semi, ignoring his proffered hand. He recoils, holds up his hand, looks at it to see if there's something wrong with it.
280.title: Aluminum case
280.abstract: An aluminum case is provided. The aluminum case comprises an aluminum material, and the aluminum case further comprises at least one groove extending in a longitudinal direction of the aluminum case to define a plurality of sub-regions separated from each other by the at least one groove. Each of the plurality of sub-regions has a thickness less than or equal to about 0.5 mm.

281.content: But the next time the laser darts into his face, it scatters off a million tiny, ashy particulates and reveals itself as a pure geometric line in space, pointing straight back to its source. It's a gargoyle, standing in the dimness next to a shanty. Just in case he's not already conspicuous enough, he's wearing a suit. Hiro starts walking toward him. Gargoyles represent the embarrassing side of the Central Intelligence Corporation. Instead of using laptops, they wear their computers on their bodies, broken up into separate modules that hang on the waist, on the back, on the headset. They serve as human surveillance devices, recording everything that happens around them. Nothing looks stupider; these getups are the modern-day equivalent of the slide-rule scabbard or the calculator pouch on the belt, marking the user as belonging to a class that is at once above and far below human society. They are a boon to Hiro because they embody the worst stereotype of the CIC stringer. They draw all of the attention. The payoff for this self-imposed ostracism is that you can be in the Metaverse all the time, and gather intelligence all the time. The CIC brass can't stand these guys because they upload staggering quantities of useless information to the database, on the off chance that some of it will eventually be useful. It's like writing down the license number of every car you see on your way to work each morning, just in case one of them will be involved in a hit-and-run accident. Even the CIC database can only hold so much garbage.
281.title: Augmented reality glasses with holographic heads-up display (HUD) and augmented reality heads-up display (HUD) for augmented reality glasses
281.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include an augmented reality headset. The augmented reality headset may comprise at least one optical element configured to direct light toward a user's eye, wherein the at least one optical element is further configured to receive light reflected from the user's eye in response to illuminating the user's eye with the light. The augmented reality headset may also comprise a projector coupled to the at least one optical element, wherein the projector is configured to project virtual content onto the at least one optical element such that the virtual content is directed toward the user's eye by the at least one optical element.

282.content: “Okay. Let's get some work done. Look up every piece of free information in the Library that contains L. Bob Rife and arrange it in chronological order. The emphasis here is on free.” “Television and newspapers, yes, sir. One moment, sir,” the Librarian says. He turns around and exits on crepe soles. Hiro turns his attention to Earth. The level of detail is fantastic. The resolution, the clarity, just the look of it, tells Hiro, or anyone else who knows computers, that this piece of software is some heavy shit. It's not just continents and oceans. It looks exactly like the earth would look from a point in geosynchronous orbit directly above L.A., complete with weather systems—vast spinning galaxies of clouds, hovering just above the surface of the globe, casting gray shadows on the oceans—and polar ice caps, fading and fragmenting into the sea.
282.title: Computer-implemented methods and systems for managing data
282.abstract: A computer-implemented method of managing data is provided. The method includes receiving, by one or more processors, an indication of a plurality of documents to be merged into a single document. The method further includes determining, by the one or more processors, that at least some of the plurality of documents are not suitable for merging into the single document. The method additionally includes generating, by the one or more processors, metadata associated with each of the at least some of the plurality of documents in response to determining that the at least some of the plurality of documents are not suitable for merging into the single document.

283.content: The screens are blank at first, but finally the same image snaps into existence on all four of them at once. It is an image consisting of words; it says 69 “This is exactly the kind of high-tech nonsense that never, ever worked when we tried it in Vietnam,” Uncle Enzo says. “Your point is well taken. But technology has come a long way since then,” says Ky, the surveillance man from Ng Security Industries. Ky is talking to Uncle Enzo over a radio headset; his van, full of electronic gear, is lurking a quarter of a mile away in the shadows next to a LAX cargo warehouse. “I am monitoring the entire airport, and all its approaches, with a three-dimensional Metaverse display. For example, I know that your dog tags, which you customarily wear around your neck, are missing. I know that you are carrying one Kongbuck and eighty-five Kongpence in change in your left pocket.
283.title: Method and apparatus for detecting unauthorized entry into a secure area
283.abstract: A method of detecting an unauthorized entry into a secure area is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device from at least one sensor associated with the secure area, data indicative of movement within the secure area; determining, by the computing device, whether the received data satisfies a predetermined criterion; in response to determining that the received data satisfies the predetermined criterion, transmitting, by the computing device, a notification comprising information about the detected unauthorized entry via a communication network; and providing, by the computing device, access to the secure area only to users authorized to enter the secure area. An apparatus for detecting an unauthorized entry into a secure area is also disclosed. A non-transitory computer readable storage medium storing instructions executable by a processor to perform the above-described method is also disclosed.

284.content: . The Tungus tribesmen of Siberia say that when the shaman goes into his trance and raves incoherent syllables, he learns the entire language of Nature.” “The language of Nature.”
284.title: Apparatus and method for communicating with an extraterrestrial intelligence
284.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for communicating with an extraterrestrial intelligence (ETI). In some embodiments, the ETI may be located within a star system that is relatively close to Earth. A space probe may be launched from Earth toward the star system in order to communicate with the ETI. The space probe may include one or more antennae configured to transmit radio frequency signals into interstellar space so as to be received by the ETI. One or more sensors of the space probe may also be used to receive information from the ETI via electromagnetic radiation emitted by the ETI.

285.content: The Enforcers turn the entire block into a mobile cop headquarters with cars and paddy wagons and satellite links on flatbed trucks. Dudes with white coats are walking up and down through the hop field with Geiger counters. Squeaky is wandering around with his headset, staring into space, carrying on conversations with people who aren't there. A tow truck shows up, towing T-Bone's black BMW behind it. “Yo, pod.” Hiro turns around and looks. It's Y.T.
285.title: Method and apparatus for enforcing compliance with traffic laws
285.abstract: A method of controlling an autonomous vehicle is disclosed. The method includes determining that the autonomous vehicle is in violation of a traffic law, wherein the traffic law prohibits operation of the autonomous vehicle within a predetermined distance from another vehicle. In response to determining that the autonomous vehicle is in violation of the traffic law, the method further includes reducing speed of the autonomous vehicle such that the autonomous vehicle remains within the predetermined distance from the other vehicle until the autonomous vehicle is no longer in violation of the traffic law.

286.content: By the time he and Hiro have sat back down in the dining room, the Kowloon has pulled away from the pier and is headed down the fjord, following a course parallel to the smaller boat that is towing the segment. As they eat, they can look out the window, across a few hundred yards of open water, and see the segment keeping pace with them.
286.title: Method and apparatus for transporting a segment of an offshore wind turbine
286.abstract: A method is provided for transporting a segment of an offshore wind turbine. The method includes the steps of arranging at least one lifting device (102, 104) in such a way that it can be moved along a track (106), moving the at least one lifting device (102, 104) from a first position to a second position by means of a drive unit (108). In the second position, the at least one lifting device (102, 104) is arranged so as to form a load-bearing surface with respect to a segment (S) of the offshore wind turbine which is located above the load-bearing surface when the at least one lifting device (102, 104) is in the second position. The method also includes lowering the segment (S) onto the load-bearing

287.content: You never know when something will be useful, so you might as well videotape it. People make their living that way—people in the intel business. People like Hiro Protagonist. They just know stuff, or they just go around and videotape stuff. They put it in the Library. When people want to know the particular things that they know or watch their videotapes, they pay them money and check it out of the Library, or just buy it outright. This is a weird racket, but Y.T. likes the idea of it.
287.title: Method and system for managing digital content
287.abstract: A method of managing digital content includes receiving, by a computing device from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), an indication of the user's desire to access at least one piece of digital content. The GUI comprises a plurality of tiles each corresponding to a respective piece of digital content. Each tile is configured to display metadata associated with its corresponding piece of digital content. Responsive to receiving the indication of the user's desire to access the at least one piece of digital content, the computing device determines that the at least one piece of digital content has not been accessed within a predetermined period of time. In response to determining that the at least one piece of digital content has not been accessed within the predetermined period of time, the computing device causes presentation of information identifying the at least one piece of digital content.

288.content: It uses the human brain as a host. The host—the human—makes copies of it. And more humans come to synagogue and read it.” “I cannot process an analogy. But what you say is correct insofar as this: After the deuteronomists had reformed Judaism, instead of making sacrifices, the Jews went to synagogue and read the Book. If not for the deuteronomists, the world's monotheists would still be sacrificing animals and propagating their beliefs through the oral tradition.” “Sharing needles,” Hiro says.
288.title: Method and apparatus for sharing needles
288.abstract: A method of sharing hypodermic needles includes receiving, by a computing device from a first user, a request to share the hypodermic needle with one or more second users; determining, by the computing device, an amount of time that has elapsed since use of the hypodermic needle by the first user; identifying, by the computing device, one or more second users who are authorized to receive the hypodermic needle according to the amount of time that has elapsed since use of the hypodermic needle by the first user; and transmitting, by the computing device, information associated with the hypodermic needle to the one or more second users.

289.content: That gave him power to create nam-shubs. And nam-shubs had the power to alter the functioning of the brain and of the body.” “Why isn't anyone doing this kind of thing nowadays?
289.title: Systems and methods for treating neurological disorders
289.abstract: The present invention relates to systems and methods for the treatment of neurological disorders, such as Parkinson's Disease (PD), Alzheimer's Disease (AD), Huntington's Disease (HD), Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS), Tourette Syndrome (TS), Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), bipolar disorder (BD), major depressive disorder (MDD), post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), or any combination thereof.

290.content: He comes around a corner and finds himself on the waterfront street, looking straight into the facade of the Spectrum 2000. On the other side is water. The chopper's coming up the fjord, following it inland from the open sea, headed straight for the Spectrum 2000. It's a small one, an agile number with a lot of glass. Hiro can see the crosses painted all over it where the red stars used to be. It is brilliant and dazzling in the cool blue light of early morning because it's shedding a trail of stars, blue-white magnesium flares tumbling out of it every few seconds, landing in the water below, where they continue to burn, leaving an astral pathway marked out down the length of the harbor.
290.title: Apparatus and method for detecting and locating radio frequency (RF) transmitters
290.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed for detecting and locating radio frequency (RF) transmitters. In one embodiment, an RF detector is provided that includes at least one antenna configured to receive signals transmitted by the RF transmitter(s). The RF detector further includes processing circuitry coupled to the antenna(s), wherein the processing circuitry is configured to process the signal(s) received by the antenna(s) in order to determine whether or not there is an RF transmitter within range of the antenna(s). If it is determined that there is an RF transmitter within range of the antenna(s), then the processing circuitry may be used to locate the position of the RF transmitter relative to the antenna(s).

291.content: Hiro leaves his bike on the Street, takes the elevator up to the 397th floor, and comes face to face with a receptionist daemon. For a moment, he can't peg her racial background; then he realizes that this daemon is half-black, half-Asian—just like him.
291.title: Systems and methods for managing access to resources in a multi-tenant computing environment based on a user's race or ethnicity
291.abstract: A system may include one or more processors configured to execute instructions that cause the system to perform operations. The operations may include receiving, from a client device associated with a first user of a first race or ethnicity, a request to access a resource provided by a second user of a second race or ethnicity different from the first race or ethnicity. The operations may also include determining whether the first user is authorized to access the resource based at least in part on an association between the first race or ethnicity and another race or ethnicity. In response to determining that the first user is not authorized to access the resource, the operations may include preventing the first user from accessing the resource. Numerous other aspects are contemplated.

292.content: It is picking its way over a broad tangle of open-air plumbing, the pipes that carry the fuel to the jets, jumping over some obstacles, digging its metallic claws into others, tearing them open with the explosive thrust of its legs, igniting their contents with the sparks that fly whenever its feet touch the pavement. It gathers its four legs under it, leaps a hundred feet to the top of a buried tank, uses that as a launch pad for another long, arcing leap over the chain link fence that separates the fuel installation from the airport proper, and then it settles into a long, steady, powerful lope, accelerating across the perfect geometric plane of the runway, chased by a long tongue of flame that extends lazily from the middle of the conflagration, whorling inward upon itself as it traces the currents in that Rat Thing's aftershock. Something tells L. Bob Rife to get away from the jet, which is loaded with fuel. He turns and half jumps, half falls off the stairs, moving clumsily because he's looking at the Rat Thing, not at the ground. The Rat Thing, just a tiny dark thing close to the ground, visible only by virtue of its shadow against the flames, and by the chain of white sparks where its claws dig into the pavement, makes a tiny correction in its course.
292.title: Method and apparatus for controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)
292.abstract: A method of controlling an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) is disclosed. The method comprises the steps of: determining, by at least one sensor associated with the UAV, a current position of the UAV relative to a target location; identifying whether the current position of the UAV satisfies a predetermined condition; in response to identification that the current position of the UAV satisfies the predetermined condition, adjusting a flight path of the UAV such that the UAV flies towards the target location; and in response to identification that the current position of the UAV does not satisfy the predetermined condition, flying the UAV along the flight path until the current position of the UAV satisfies the predetermined condition.

293.content: Fisheye uses Reason to hose down the area from which the Molotov was thrown, but now that the side of the boat is all lit up from the flames, they draw more small-arms fire. In that light, Hiro can see trickles of blood running down from the area where Vic ensconced himself. On the port side, he sees something long and narrow and low in the water, with the torso of a man rising out of it.
293.title: Molotov cocktail
293.abstract: (i) an ignition source; and(ii) at least one flammable liquid,wherein the molotov cocktail is configured to be thrown or otherwise propelled in such a manner as to cause the ignition source to come into contact with the at least one flammable liquid so as to initiate combustion of the at least one flammable liquid thereby causing the molotov cocktail to explode.

294.content: The Enforcer can only see the front half and his hands are playing up and down it, trying to verify what his eyes are seeing. Then the back half whacks into a parked car, spraying a narrow fan of head cheese across the waxed and polished trunk lid. The car's alarm goes off. The Enforcer hears the sound and turns around to see what it is. When Hiro last sees him, he is running down the center of the pulsating neon street toward the center of Chinatown, wailing a terrible, random song that clashes with the bleating of the car alarm. Hiro feels even at this moment that something has been torn open in the world and that he is dangling above the gap, staring into a place where he does not want to be. Lost in the biomass. Hiro draws his katana. “Squeaky!” Hiro hollers.
294.title: Method, system, and apparatus for detecting unauthorized use of a vehicle
294.abstract: A method includes determining that an ignition interlock device (IID) has been removed from a vehicle. The IID is configured to prevent the vehicle from being started when the IID is not present in the vehicle. The method further includes transmitting one or more alerts indicating that the IID has been removed from the vehicle.

295.content: It takes half a dozen tries to secure the grappling hook in the jagged hole, twenty feet above the waterline. As he's wriggling through the hole, his coverall makes popping and hissing noises as the hot, sharp metal melts and tears through the synthetic material. He ends up leaving scraps of it behind, welded to the hull.
295.title: Method and apparatus for retrieving an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) from a body of water
295.abstract: A method is provided for recovering an Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) from a body of water. The method includes determining that the UAV is to be recovered from the body of water, wherein the UAV has landed in the body of water after completing one or more flight missions. The method further includes deploying a recovery device into the body of water at a predetermined location relative to the UAV. The method also includes releasing the UAV from the recovery device such that the UAV flies away from the recovery device.

296.content: Hiro starts walking away from the Street, toward the cube. It reflects no light at all, so he can't tell whether it's ten feet or ten miles away from him until the security daemons begin to materialize. There are half a dozen of them, all big sturdy avatars in blue coveralls, sort of quasimilitary looking, but without rank. They don't need rank because they're all running the same program. They materialize around him in a neat semicircle with a radius of about ten feet, blocking Hiro's way to the cube. Hiro mumbles a word under his breath and vanishes—he slips into his invisible avatar. It would be very interesting to hang around and see how these security daemons deal with it, but right now he has to get moving before they get a chance to adjust. They don't, at least not very well. Hiro runs between two of the security daemons and heads for the wall of the cube.
296.title: Method and apparatus for controlling access to an object
296.abstract: A method of controlling access to an object is disclosed. The method comprises receiving, by a computing device from a user via a communication network, at least one biometric data associated with the user; determining whether the received at least one biometric data matches stored biometric data corresponding to the user; in response to determining that the received at least one biometric data does not match the stored biometric data corresponding to the user, transmitting, by the computing device over the communication network, a notification indicating that the user is not authorized to access the object; and accessing, by the computing device, the object when it is determined that the received at least one biometric data matches the stored biometric data corresponding to the user. Various other methods, systems, and computer-readable media are also disclosed.

297.content: It is an agglutinative tongue, meaning that it is a collection of morphemes or syllables that are grouped into words—very unusual.” “You are saying,” Hiro says, remembering Da5id in the hospital, “that if I could hear someone speaking Sumerian, it would sound like a long stream of short syllables strung together.”
297.title: Apparatus and method for communicating with a deaf or hard-of-hearing person
297.abstract: A communication apparatus is provided. The communication apparatus includes an acoustic transceiver configured to receive audio data from a microphone of the communication apparatus, convert the audio data into electrical signals, and transmit the electrical signals to a speaker of the communication apparatus so as to play back sound corresponding to the received audio data. The communication apparatus further includes at least one processor configured to control operation of the acoustic transceiver in accordance with predetermined instructions stored therein. A non-transitory computer-readable storage medium storing the predetermined instructions is also provided.

298.content: And the tension on the rope is such that he can't get it unhooked from the stanchion. As he's squatting there playing with the grappling hook, a greasy hand rises up out of the water and grabs his wrist. Another hand gropes for Hiro's other hand and grabs the sword instead. Hiro yanks the weapon free, feeling it do damage, and shoves the wakizashi point first into the place between those two hands just as someone is sinking his teeth into Hiro's crotch. But Hiro's crotch is protected—the motorcycle outfit has a hard plastic cup—and so this human shark just gets a mouthful of bullet-proof fabric.
298.title: Method and apparatus for retrieving an object from a body of water
298.abstract: A method is disclosed for retrieving an object from a body of water. The method comprises the steps of: (a) deploying at least one buoy in the body of water; (b) locating the object within the body of water by transmitting acoustic pulses into the body of water, wherein the acoustic pulses are reflected off the object to produce echoes that are detected by receivers associated with the at least one buoy; (c) determining a location of the object relative to the at least one buoy using the received echoes; and (d) moving the at least one buoy towards the object such that the at least one buoy becomes proximate to the object so as to facilitate removal of the object from the body of water. An apparatus for retrieving an object from a body of water is also disclosed.

299.content: She said you'd recognize the name.” “I recognize the name.
299.title: Method and apparatus for identifying a user of a computing device
299.abstract: A method is provided for identifying a user of a computing device. The method includes obtaining, by the computing device, at least one biometric input from a user of the computing device; comparing, by the computing device, the at least one biometric input to previously stored biometric information associated with users of the computing device; determining, by the computing device, whether the at least one biometric input matches any of the previously stored biometric information; in response to determining that the at least one biometric input does not match any of the previously stored biometric information, storing, by the computing device, the at least one biometric input as new biometric information associated with the user of the computing device; and authenticating, by the computing device, the user of the computing device using the new biometric information. A corresponding apparatus, system, computer program product, and method are also disclosed.

300.content: At least a dozen small boats are around them. “They got Molotov cocktails,” Vic says. The people in the boats can see them, too. Tracers fly around them from several directions. Hiro can see muzzle flashes in at least three places. Fisheye opens up once, twice with Reason, just firing short bursts of a few dozen rounds each, and produces one fireball, this one farther away from the yacht. It's been at least five seconds since Hiro moved, so he checks this area for grappling hooks again and resumes his circuit around the edge of the yacht. This time it's clear. The two greaseballs must have been working together.
300.title: Method and apparatus for defeating an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) or unmanned aerial system (UAS)
300.abstract: A method of defeating an Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) or Unmanned Aerial System (UAS) includes the steps of identifying at least one UAV/UAS operating within a predetermined geographic area; determining whether the at least one UAV/UAS is authorized to operate within the predetermined geographic area; if the at least one UAV/UAS is not authorized to operate within the predetermined geographic area, transmitting a jamming signal to the at least one UAV/UAS thereby preventing operation of the at least one UAV/UAS in the predetermined geographic area.

301.content: At the same time, she jerks the manual release on her cervical collar and goes into full Michelin Man mode as tiny gas cartridges detonate in several strategic locations around her bod. The biggest one goes off like an M-80 at the nape of her neck, unfurling the coverall's collar into a cylindrical gasbag that shoots straight up and encases her entire head.
301.title: Method and apparatus for restraining and/or immobilizing a person
301.abstract: A method of restraining and/or immobilizing a person comprising the steps of: (a) positioning at least one stunner device in close proximity to said person's body; (b) activating said at least one stunner device so as to cause an electrical current to flow from said at least one stunner device into said person's body.

302.content: That story has to be a metaphor for something else. I think it is a metaphor for some kind of recursive informational process.
302.title: Systems and methods for managing information
302.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for managing information. In one implementation, a method includes receiving an indication that a first user is interacting with a second user in a virtual reality (VR) environment associated with a VR system. The method may also include determining whether the first user has previously interacted with the second user outside of the VR environment. Responsive to a determination that the first user has not previously interacted with the second user outside of the VR environment, the method further includes causing presentation of content related to the interaction between the first user and the second user in the VR environment via the VR system.

303.content: There is a constant undulation of the ground that makes the shattered glass flash and twinkle; this is caused by vast, sparse migrations of rats. The deep, computer-designed imprints of suburban boys' fat knobby tires paint giant runes on the clay, like the mystery figures in Peru that Y.T.'s mom learned about at the NeoAquarian Temple. Through the windows, Y.T. can hear occasional bursts of either firecrackers or gunfire. She can also hear Ng making new, even stranger sounds with his mouth. There is a built-in speaker system in this van—a stereo, though far be it from Ng to actually listen to any tunes. Y.T. can feel it turning on, can sense a nearly inaudible hiss coming from the speakers. The van begins to creep forward across the Zone. The inaudible hiss gathers itself up into a low electronic hum.
303.title: Method and apparatus for transporting a human being through a post-apocalyptic wasteland
303.abstract: A method of transporting a human being through a post-apocalyptic wasteland includes the steps of (a) providing an autonomous vehicle; (b) programming the autonomous vehicle to follow a predetermined route, wherein the predetermined route comprises one or more waypoints; (c) loading into the autonomous vehicle at least one human being; (d) driving the autonomous vehicle along the predetermined route until the autonomous vehicle arrives at a first waypoint in the predetermined route; (e) stopping the autonomous vehicle at the first waypoint; (f) exiting from the autonomous vehicle; (g) allowing the human being(s) to leave the autonomous vehicle; (h) re-entering the autonomous vehicle after the human being(s) have left the autonomous vehicle; (i) driving the autonomous vehicle away from the first waypoint

304.content: He leans up on one elbow, separating their bodies for a moment, plants his mouth on hers to maintain the contact, fills her mouth with his tongue, holds her there with it while he one-hands the fastener at the collar of her coverall and yanks the zipper all the way down to the crotch. It's open now, exposing a broad V of skin converging from her shoulders. He rolls back onto her, grabs the top of the coverall with both hands and pulls it down behind her, forcing her arms down and to her sides, stuffing the mass of fabric and pads down underneath the small of her back so she stays arched up toward him.
304.title: Method and apparatus for treating a patient in an ambulance
304.abstract: A method of treating a patient in an ambulance includes determining, by at least one processor, that the patient is experiencing respiratory distress. In response to determining that the patient is experiencing respiratory distress, controlling, by the at least one processor, delivery of supplemental oxygen to the patient via a face mask attached to the patient.

305.content: Another Crip comes running out into the street half a second after Hiro, as Raven is pulling away. He slows for a moment to take stock of the situation, then charges the motorcycle like a linebacker. He is crying out as he does so, a war cry. Squeaky emerges about the same time as the Crip, starts chasing both of them down the street. Raven seems to be unaware of the Crip running behind him, but in hindsight it seems apparent that he has been watching his approach in the rearview mirror of the motorcycle. As the Crip comes in range, Raven's hand lets go of the throttle for a moment, snaps back as if he is throwing away a piece of litter. His fist strikes the middle of the Crip's face like a frozen ham shot out of a cannon.
305.title: Motorcycle ride-along
305.abstract: A motorcycle ride-along apparatus and method are disclosed. The motorcycle ride-along apparatus comprises at least one sensor configured to detect an environment of the motorcycle; a controller in communication with the at least one sensor, wherein the controller is configured to receive data from the at least one sensor indicative of the environment of the motorcycle detected by the at least one sensor; compare the received data against predetermined thresholds associated with safe operation of the motorcycle; determine that the motorcycle is not operating within the predetermined thresholds when the received data indicates that the motorcycle is not operating within the predetermined thresholds; and transmit a signal indicating that the motorcycle is not operating within the predetermined thresholds.

306.content: They don't look real happy about this particular duty, they keep casting sidelong glances at the motorcycle. The head Crip keeps goading them forward with his voice, shooing them toward Raven with his hands. Each one of them has a hand-held metal-detecting wand.
306.title: Method and apparatus for detecting contraband in a correctional facility
306.abstract: A method of detecting contraband at a correctional facility is disclosed. The method includes receiving, by a computing device associated with the correctional facility, one or more images of an area of the correctional facility; processing, by the computing device, the one or more images to identify objects within the one or more images; determining, by the computing device, whether each object identified within the one or more images comprises contraband; and transmitting, by the computing device, data indicative of which objects within the one or more images comprise contraband. An apparatus for detecting contraband at a correctional facility is also disclosed. A non-transitory computer readable medium storing instructions executable by a processor to detect contraband at a correctional facility is also disclosed. Finally, a system for detecting contraband at a correctional facility is also disclosed.

307.content: “He was in an unfortified position, exposed from all sides,” Ng says. “He chose to work from a suicidal position. Which is not a typical behavior for drug dealers. Typically, they are more pragmatic. Now, do you have any other criticisms of my performance?”
307.title: Apparatus and method for detecting illicit narcotics
307.abstract: An apparatus for detecting illicit narcotics, the apparatus comprising at least one detector configured to emit electromagnetic radiation into a sample suspected of containing an illicit narcotic, wherein the at least one detector is configured to receive reflected electromagnetic radiation from the sample in response to the emitted electromagnetic radiation. The apparatus further comprises processing circuitry configured to determine whether the sample contains an illicit narcotic based on characteristics of the received reflected electromagnetic radiation. A method for detecting illicit narcotics is also disclosed.

308.content: The number is stored in the big computer in Brooklyn. Jason grew up in the western suburbs of Chicago, one of the most highly franchised regions in the country. He attended the University of Illinois business school, racking up a GPA of 2.9567, and did a senior thesis called “The Interaction of the Ethnographic, Financial, and Paramilitary Dimensions of Competition in Certain Markets.” This was a case study of turf struggle between Nova Sicilia and Narcolombia franchises in his old neighborhood in Aurora. Enrique Cortazar ran the failing Narcolombia franchise upon which Jason had hinged his argument.
308.title: Systems and methods for detecting fraudulent transactions
308.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for detecting fraudulent transactions. In one implementation, a method includes receiving transaction data associated with a plurality of transactions; determining that at least one of the plurality of transactions is suspected to be fraudulent; in response to determining that at least one of the plurality of transactions is suspected to be fraudulent, identifying an entity associated with the at least one of the plurality of transactions that is suspected to be fraudulent

309.content: What's the difference?” Hiro finally realizes that he has just wasted sixty seconds of his life having a meaningless conversation with a paranoid schizophrenic. He turns around and goes into The Black Sun. 6 At the exit of White Columns sits a black car, curled up like a panther, a burnished steel lens reflecting the loglo of Oahu Road. It is a Unit. It is a Mobile Unit of MetaCops Unlimited. A silvery badge is embossed on its door, a chrome-plated cop badge the size of a dinner plate, bearing the name of said private peace organization and emblazoned DIAL 1-800-THE COPS All Major Credit Cards MetaCops Unlimited is the official peacekeeping force of White Columns, and also of The Mews at Windsor Heights, The Heights at Bear Run, Cinnamon Grove, and The Farms of Cloverdelle. They also enforce traffic regulations on all highways and byways operated by Fairlanes, Inc. A few different FOQNEs also use them: Caymans Plus and The Alps, for example. But franchise nations prefer to have their own security force.
309.title: Systems, methods, and non-transitory computer-readable media are disclosed herein for providing a MetaCops Unlimited system. The MetaCops Unlimited system may include a MetaCops Unlimited server configured to receive a
309.abstract: request from a client device associated with a user requesting access to one or more services of the MetaCops Unlimited system; determining that the request originates from an untrusted IP address; in response to determining that the request originates from an untrusted IP address, transmitting a challenge to the client device over a secure connection between the MetaCops Unlimited server and the client device; receiving authentication information from the client device via the secure connection; validating the authentication information against at least one credential associated with the user; authorizing the client device to access the one or more services of the MetaCops Unlimited system responsive to validation of the authentication information against the at least one credential associated with the user by the MetaCops Unlimited server. Other systems, methods, and non-transitory computer-readable media are also disclosed herein.

310.content: Tonight, it is occupied by the grandest and most brilliant computer hallucinations that the human mind can invent. A three-dimensional marquee hangs above it, announcing tonight's event: a benefit graphics concert staged on behalf of Da5id Meier, who is still hospitalized with an inexplicable disease. The amphitheater is half filled with hackers. Once he gets out of Downtown, Hiro twists his throttle up to the max and covers the remaining thirty-two thousand and some kilometers in the space of about ten minutes. Over his head, the express trains are whooshing down the track at a metaphorical speed of ten thousand miles per hour; he passes them like they're standing still.
310.title: Methods, systems, and computer-readable media for managing data in a computing environment are provided herein. In one embodiment, a method for managing data in a computing environment is disclosed. The method includes receiving a request to
310.abstract: The present disclosure relates to systems and methods for providing an automated notification of the status of a vehicle. An exemplary system comprises a memory configured to store instructions; and at least one processor configured to execute the stored instructions to control operation of the system. The execution of the stored instructions by the at least one processor causes the system to receive sensor data from sensors associated with a vehicle; analyze the received sensor data to determine whether the vehicle is operational or non-operational; if the vehicle is determined to be non-operational, generate an automated notification indicating that the vehicle is non-operational; and transmit the generated automated notification to a recipient device via a communication network.

311.content: Squeaky pulls on a pair of latex gloves. He hauls the briefcase out, sets it on the trunk lid, and rips the latches open with a small prybar. Whatever it is, it is complicated and highly designed. The top half of the case has several rows of the small red-capped tubes that Hiro saw at the U-Stor-It. There are five rows with maybe twenty tubes in each row. The bottom half of the case appears to be some kind of miniaturized, old-fashioned computer terminal. Most of it is occupied by a keyboard. There is a small liquid-crystal display screen that can probably handle about five lines of text at a time. There is a penlike object attached to the case by a cable, maybe three feet long uncoiled. It looks like it might be a light pen or a bar-code scanner. Above the keyboard is a lens, set at an angle so that it is aimed at whoever is typing on the keyboard. There are other features whose purpose is not so obvious: a slot, which might be a place to insert a credit or ID card, and a cylindrical socket that is about the size of one of those little tubes. This is Hiro's reconstruction of how the thing looked at one time. When Hiro sees it, it is melted together.
311.title: Apparatus and method for secure storage and retrieval of data
311.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method are disclosed herein. An example embodiment may include an apparatus comprising one or more processors coupled to non-transitory computer readable medium storing instructions that when executed by the one or more processors cause the one or more processors to perform operations comprising receiving at least one input from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), determining whether the received at least one input is associated with a predefined action, in response to determining that the received at least one input is not associated with a predefined action, transmitting the received at least one input to a trusted execution environment (TEE) where it is stored as encrypted data, decrypting the encrypted data using a private key corresponding to the TEE, and providing the decrypted data back to the GUI.

312.content: It would be easy to say that Hiro is a stupid investor and Juanita a smart one, but the facts are a little more complicated than that: Juanita put her eggs in one basket, keeping all her money in Black Sun stock; as it turns out, she made a lot of money that way, but she could have gone broke, too. And Hiro didn't have a lot of choice in some ways.
312.title: Systems and methods for managing investment portfolios
312.abstract: Implementations of the present disclosure include systems and methods for generating an investment portfolio. The method includes receiving, by a computing device, one or more inputs from a user via a graphical user interface (GUI), wherein the one or more inputs are associated with at least one financial parameter; determining, by the computing device, that the received one or more inputs satisfy a predetermined condition; in response to determining that the received one or more inputs satisfy the predetermined condition, identifying, by the computing device, a plurality of mutual funds corresponding to the received one or more inputs; calculating, by the computing device, a weighted average value for each of the plurality of mutual funds; and generating, by the computing device, an investment portfolio comprising the calculated weighted average value for each of the plurality of mutual funds. Various other aspects are contemplated.

313.content: He has looked at it, scoped it out, memorized the location of the shed and the picnic table, can find them even in the dark—knows that if it ever came to this, a twenty-three-minute pizza, miles to go, and a slowdown at CSV-5 and Oahu—he could enter The Mews at Windsor Heights (his electronic delivery-man's visa would raise the gate automatically), scream down Heritage Boulevard, rip the turn onto Strawbridge Place (ignoring the DEAD END sign and the speed limit and the CHILDREN PLAYING ideograms that are strung so liberally throughout TMAWH), thrash the speed bumps with his mighty radials, blast up the driveway of Number 15 Strawbridge Circle, cut a hard left around the backyard shed, careen into the backyard of Number 84 Mayapple Place, avoid its picnic table (tricky), get into their driveway and out onto Mayapple, which takes him to Bellewoode Valley Road, which runs straight to the exit of the Burbclave. TMAWH security police might be waiting for him at the exit, but their STDs, Severe Tire Damage devices, only point one way—they can keep people out, but not keep them in.
313.title: Method and apparatus for delivering pizza
313.abstract: A method of preparing a pizza includes receiving an order to prepare a pizza. The method also includes determining that the customer is located within a predetermined geographic area, wherein the predetermined geographic area comprises one or more delivery zones. The method further includes selecting at least one delivery zone from among the one or more delivery zones in response to determining that the customer is located within the predetermined geographic area.

314.content: Pays to beef up your security when the Raft is coming through. Hiro proceeds to the counter. A man is talking on the phone in Cantonese, which means that he is, in fact, shouting. Hiro recognizes him as the Port Sherman proconsul. He is deeply involved in this little chat, but he has definitely noticed Hiro's swords, is watching him carefully. “We are very busy,” the man says, hanging up.
314.title: Method and apparatus for securing a raft
314.abstract: A method of securing a raft to a substrate is disclosed. The method includes positioning the raft over an opening in the substrate, wherein the raft comprises a plurality of protrusions extending outwardly from a top surface of the raft; inserting at least one fastener through each of the plurality of protrusions into the substrate so as to secure the raft to the substrate around the opening; and forming a bead of adhesive material between opposing sides of each of the plurality of protrusions such that the bead of adhesive material secures the raft to the substrate around the opening without penetrating any of the plurality of protrusions. An apparatus for securing a raft to a substrate is also disclosed.

315.content: She picks up a couple of the vials, reads their labels. “What did you find?” Ng says when she gets back into the van, peels off the mask. “Needles. Mostly Hyponarxes. But there's also a couple of Ultra Laminars and some Mosquito twenty-fives.” “What does all this mean?” “Hyponarx you can get at any Buy 'n' Fly, people call them rusty nails, they are cheap and dull. Supposedly the needles of poor black diabetics and junkies. Ultra Laminars and Mosquitos are hip, you get them around fancy Burbclaves, they don't hurt as much when you stick them in, and they have better design. You know, ergonomic plungers, hip color schemes.” “What drug were they injecting?” “Checkitout,” Y.T. says, and holds up one of the vials toward Ng.
315.title: Apparatus and method for simulating a zombie apocalypse
315.abstract: A system, apparatus, and method for simulating a zombie apocalypse are disclosed.
